text: Der Antrunk ist süsslich, malzbetont. Alkoholnoten dringen durch, hopfig im Abgang. Nach jedem Schluck macht sich die viel zu hoch dosierte Kohlensäure bemerkbar! Das Bier schmeckt überhaupt nicht nach Weizen, eher wie ein billiges Export-Dosenbier.

Pours with an okay amount of white dense fluffly foam. Color is very attractive clear orange. Fresh and lightly fruity aroma has mango, some citrus, fresh hops, some sweet malt notes. Some alcohol aroma. The banana aroma is very underpronounced, which is probably a feature of filtered wheat beers. Palate is a bit dry, but the carbonation is okay. Taste is hoppy and reminds of watery pilsner more than a wheat beer. Compared to pilsners this beer is less hoppy and more malty and sweet though. The aroma is not complex, I mostly taste just hops (although the hoppiness of this is very good) and malts. There are some vanilla and chocolate notes "in the middle". Its surely a refreshing wheat beer and theres nothing wrong in it, but its perhaps a bit boring. Therefore its more suited for enjoying at a terrace, rather than as a complex beer sipped slowly in an armchair.

From old tasting notes. Clear bright yellow gold liquid topped by a big bubbly white head. Crisp clean wheat malt nose.nsubtle wheat malt flavor lacks the spiciness of the Bavarian wheat beers. Light dry finish is brief but refreshing.

Very light yellow with a strong head. Crystal clear as the name says. Wheat, sugar, a hint of earthy yeast. Very light taste of wheat and barley. Light as befits a filtered wheat beer. Not bad but certainly not exciting in any way.

0,5l bottle at home from trade with Maracuja05, big thanks. BB 08/2017. golden clear shiny color, medium big white head. smells tobacco, light ripe fruits, grassy, bit musty, bit dusty, light grains. decent smell overall. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly of ripe fruits, tobacco, lightly metallic, bit peppery, spices, grains, lightly breadish, light glue. finishes lightly bitter with notes of grass, tobacco and some bread. quite decent one overall, not much weizen character left though, quite drinkable.
Halmgul med massa skum. Luktar lite hö. Smakar lite fadd. Lite skumbanan. Men ingen jäst. Förstår inte hur man skulle kunna välja en kristall om det finns hefe.

A golden beer in the own glass. Nice bubbling, a head is big and blond. Aroma has sweet fruitness of perries and bananas, hint of spicyness of wheat. Taste has fruitness, some bananas, quite sweet. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Simplified by filtering and also too sweet. Nice, anyway.

Pours clear golden with a white foamy head. Aroma is sweetish with fruits and bubblegum. Flavor is rather similar, mild and slightly sweet, but finishes with a faint bitterness. Slightly slicky mouthfeel and lively carbonation. A mild but decent thirst quencher. (500ml bottle, bb 01-2018)
Bottle from Crafty Bottle, Lincoln.pale golden colour and crystal clear. Aroma is grassy, and malts, taste light sweet. Thin watery body. Not great

500ml bottle. Pours clear pale gold with a large fluffy white head that persists. Aroma of wheat, grass, yeast. Taste follows nose with very faint banana notes, hints of white pepper. Finish is mildly sweet Heavily carbonated. Light body. OK.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Ar: Dominuje slodowosc, lagerowa, mila, nutka pszenicznej ziarnistosci. Ciekawy, lagerowo, dobrze ale bez szalu. Intensywnosc srednio-niska. Poprawnie. Wyg: klarowne, zlote, piana spoko, dosc gruba, roznoziarnista. Sm: Zbyt wysoko wysycone, poprawny lager, gladkie, bardzo slodowe, ale wodniste. Znosne. Pos: Pustka, slodowosc. W porzadku, ale pusto.

Bottle, 0.5l. Clear golden pour with three finger soapy white head. Good retention. Malty sweet taste, lots of caramel, quite herbal. Mot much of a weizen character. Pretty nice, though.

Thin body with soft carbonation. Light and watery texture. Quite weak in taste and aroma, empty. Not unpleasant, just heavily subdued and watered down. A shame, to be honest. Mild tartness in the aftertaste. Grainy aroma, herbal, a bit peppery. Malty. Slight caramel. Same as smell, not much of a weizen character at all.

Overall, pleasant, but very weak and watered down.

Golden amber with two finger fluffy head that didn't linger long 
Nose is sweet like apple-cider, hints yeast and bread. (The wife thought it had hints of orange but that passed me by)
Mouthfeel moderate carbonation, delicate, a little thin yet leaving a light slickness. 
It's has restrained fresh flavours, upfront notes of white fruit followed by a hint of bitterness but right at the back very slight acerbic metallic taste.
Best description is it's a bottle of bubbly, a sparkling beer but needs to be more robust. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. Pours light golden with small white head. Aroma is mild malts, wheat and bread. Taste has watery malts and hay. Too strong carbonation and this is just watery.

Pours shimmery metallic yellow, indeed crystal clear, large fluffy white head. Aroma is flowery,candy like,apples, anise, biscuit. Taste has hints of banana, apples, some sweetness, hint of hops. Mouthful is very light.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden, white frothy head, some lacing. Faint citrus and grassy aroma. Light-bodied, medium carbonated. Mild taste, citrus, bread and grass. Fairly crisp finish.

(Erdinger Weissbier Kristallklar) Bottle 500ml at home. ABV 5.3%
Bright golden colour on the body, crystal clear of course, with intense activity in the glass and a tall and thick white head on top, great retention.
Aroma of wheat, grass, faint fruity notes.
Taste also of wheat, fresh cut grass, fruity touches.
Medium thin body, good carbonation.
Good.

Exactly what Id expect from this style, light, crisp, refreshing, but a little bland. Aroma is weak, less fruity, there is only a hint of fruitness (some banana) towards the end of the sip, as I swallow, and a little into the finish. Flavor is very mild, slightly sweet, ever-so-slightly sour, and a tiny bitterness in the finish. Overall this beer was more flavorful in the finish, at the start of the sip it was almost like sparkling water. An odd sensation drinking. I can see this being a good summer beer, especially on a hot day, but I prefer the traditional German wheat beers, especially at this time of year (Winter).

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2016 50 cl. bottle. Very clear golden colour with a frothy white head. Average lacing. Weak to medium aroma which consists of wheat, banana, bubblegum, and hints of spice. Taste is mostly sweet, with a light sourness. Almost no bitterness. Mouthfeel is light but still pleasant. A medium-bodied, oily textured beer with lively carbonation. It has a medium finish which is a bit sour and quite acidic. Overall, it lacks the depth of a standard weissbier but its easily and pleasantly drinkable.

500ml Bottle: Pours a crystal clear golden with effervescent white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of citrus, some spice and a little bit of dish washing soap. Has some banana phenolics when tasting, but not much. Coriander is also a bit subdued. Highly carbonated with medium to light body. Slick mouthfeel with fair bitterness. Not my favourite kristal weiss.
Butelka 0,5l Aromat słodowy, mało fenoli. W smaku puste, wodniste, słodowe. Kiepsko.

Pale grain malts, light wheat, light floral hops. Clear gold, massive, frothy, white head. More pale grain malts, little else frankly, lively carbonation, light bodied. Boring Kristallweizen, not exactly too flavourful. Bottle from Wine Rack, Chiswick.
Aus der Flasche bei meinem Albaner getrunken. Leider mit der unvermeidlichen Zitronenscheibe... Kein Kommentar.

Erdinger weissbier kristall ++ ljus klar weissbier. Ton som av vetet, inte helt i min smak, det är lite bismak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Home. Pors clear golden with a white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, caramel, slight spice. Taste is rather sweet, light bitter, spice. Rather thin and quite generic.
[backlog] 18-04-16 // bottle at Retro, Mainz. Clear golden, big white head. Well carbonated. Light grassy wheat aroma.
Goldene, klare Farbe. Weiße, relativ kurz anhaltende Schaumkrone. Riecht fruchtig, etwas Banane, kaum Malz. Schmeckt ähnlich, leichte Bitternote.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Typical fruity banana, orange and tropical flavours. This is a lighter style of weissbier, but it also lacks some of the depth of the more full-on ones.

Pours Golden clear. Loose foam, medium retention. Nose is fresh and fruity, melon, orange slight banana. Taste is correspondingly fresh with fruity aromas and alight phenolic character. Carbonated and low bitterness. Nice Kristal
Banana, grains, golden with a huge but not very persistant white head, light body, medium carbonation, hints of banana, quite sweet...not so special.

Bottle (from beer gonzo). Pours clear golden with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, soapy, bananas, some grains. Flavor is sweet and somewhat bitter, fruits, bananas, wheat, slight graininess. Finish is sweet, sheath, and watery. Overall: OK for the style.
Cerveja suave e de sabor pouco marcante. Boa, mas não se destaca. Não vale o preço normal (acima de R$15,00)

500 ml. bb 07-2016. Clear golden with an enduring, loose foam on top. Nose is honey and roasted corn with a hint of spicy dried grass. Flavor is honey, apple cider, toast, corn and dry grass. Long finish shows a bit of bitter-sweet wheat. Light-medium body leans sweet and has a medium carbonation. Without the signature autolyzed yeast sediment this mostly tastes like a decent European style lager. Skip this one and get the Weihenstephaner instead.

Basically identical to the Hefeweizen. So almost the exact same review bar one word. "clear" instead of "Cloudy"
500ml bottle into a weizen. Clear yellowish orange, loose white head which didnt last. Aroma is faint and almost non existent. Reasonably carbonated and sweetish. Hints of banana at the end. OK, but not special.
Golden clear beer with small white head. The beer is a bit fuzzy, with sweet fruit aroma and a boring hops taste in the end.
Bottle. Pours clear golden. A bit fruity beer, but not like I expected. Very boring and taste like a regular lager..

Appearance: Clear golden, some fizzy white head.
Aroma: Wheat, banana, citrus.
Taste: Laid-back wheat, slight light fruits and sweetness. Some spices.
Bought: Beers of Europe, 500 ml, £2.39
Info: 27/3-2016, BB: 31/5-2016

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought in supermarket in Carvoeiro. Enjoyable clear wheat beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap (Lockvogel, Paderborn). Barwa zlocista, klarowna. Piana biala, gesta, obfita, szybko znika. Aromat slodkawy, landrynkowy, brak nut pszenicznych. W smaku lekko slodowe, slodkawe, podobnie jak w aromacie brak pszenicy. Piwo mocno wysycone, pijalne ale nie tego sie spodziewalem.

Først. Jeg bryder mig ikke om hvedeøl i almindelighed. Men denne her kan jeg godt lide (lidt ked af at den bliver kaldt en dameøl så ), den har næsten ingen smag af hvede over sig, med mere af en almindelig pilsner. På hjemmesiden skriver de at den er en god tørstslukker, jeg vil helt sikkert købe nogle flere her til sommer.

Næsten ingen humlesmag, og en tynd eftersmag.
A bit nicer than its cloudy brother. Golden yellow, with mandarine and banana. And a medium long finish.
Lighter and fruitier than normal Erdinger. Retains similar appearance - pours cloudy golden with a decent white head. Highly carbonated. Nice refreshing beer

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste lightly sweet, wheat, mild banana/fruit. I thought this was really good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle at Beer Battle, Siem Reap. Pours clear golden with a white head. Not picking up too much Weiss here. If you gave me this without the bottle Id have thought youd brought the wrong thing. This is like a sweet lager.

Bottle from systembolaget. Clear golden pour with frothy white head. Taste and flavour of wheat, cloves and white pepper. A little bit mellow, on the sweet side with a short, yeasty finish. Not so interesting.
Aus der Flasche. Klar, sehr sprudelnd. Aroma: Frisch, Zitrus, Ein wenig Hefe. Antrunk prickelnd. Geschmack: Hefe, etwas Frucht, Weizen. Kurzer Abgang
Bottle at MUC. Crystal clear (duh) golden color, big white head with decent retention. Aroma of white pepper and banana. Taste has light pepper, citrus, banana. OK.

0.5l bottle from marktkauf/edeka, 0.90. pours a clear golden with a quickly disappearing white head and little to no lacing. aroma of wheat, yeast, sweet malts, hay, sour fruits. no banana or cloves. flavour of malt, citrus, lemonade, slight bubblegum, spices, again almost no banana. strong carbonation. reminds me of a bock, a rather fizzy and fruity one.

Bottle from Fresh Fields Market, Croydon. It pours clear golden with a thick, foamy white head. The nose is mellow, soft, sweet, banana, flour, white bread, straw and cereal. The taste is crisp, clean, mellow banana, light creaminess, sweet white bread, cereal, white pepper, straw and a touch of soapy citrus with a dry finish. Medium body, fine carbonation and foamy carbonation. Crisp, sweet and clean. Its a tough style to like, but this example is pretty ok. Works well with my curry!

500ml bottle from Tegel Airport


Clear golden colour with a white head. Hay, mild malt, bulkish.
Pours a clear golden body with a medium and lasting head. Very faint aroma with malty tones. Nice and creamy taste which lays good on the tongue.

Bottle at home. Pours clear and pale with a pillowy white head. The aroma is of wet cardboard. Taste is sweet with a floury dry backtaste. Well carbonated. I dont get this one. It seems to have removed all the good characteristics of a decent wheat beer and left the bad bits. It is drinkable, but thats about it.

Flasche 0,5l: Golden, klar mit festem mittelporigem Schaum; frische, leicht malzige Noten in der Nase mit etwas Hopfen, leichter Fruchtigkeit, Getreide, Malzsilo; angenehme malzige Süße im Körper, leichte Hefenoten, Porridge; milder Abgang

Clara dourada,brilhante,límpida,espuma volumosa com média duração,alta carbonatação;aroma apresentando leve frutado,malte e fermento;sabor um tanto "aguado",com malte aparecendo,mas com frutado tênue e o picante do cravo ausente,retrogosto com leve azedume. Não gostei dessa versão filtrada,faltou o cravo,o picante e o adocicado característico.
50 cl systembolaget. Börjar beta av veteölen på sb och denna stor på tur. Ingen höjdare men passar nog till grillfesten.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: erdig, leicht süß, zitronig. Erscheinung: Goldgelbes Bier, weißer, grobporiger Schaum. Geschmack: süße, reife Birne. Nachgeschmack: kurz, süß. Gesamt: gelungenes Bier, ungewohnter Geschmack.
Draught at bar. Pale golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, wheat, banana, toast and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, banana, wheat and grass. Very nice weizen.
Bottle to glass. Full wheat and spice aroma. Clear yellow with massive pillowy head. Tons of effervescent bubbles. Taste is wheat and lemon. Not bad for what it is.
Flaska från SB. Ljust gul med vitt skum. Svag doft av skumbanan och lite humle. Lätt i smaken med liten beska.
decent for style, but its a boring style. prefer my wheats cloudy and flavorful. Nothing bad about this, but it is neither of those things.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear light amber color, white head cover, stripes of lace. Taste is sweet malt that moves effortlessly through a lightly carbonated swallow before adding a minimum of hops in a short finish. Light and easy to drink. But also, not memorable.
Farbe Goldig. Geruch nach Früchten. Geschmack eher trocken. Starke Rezenz. Kaum Weizen Geschmack. Seltsamer Nachgeschmack.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Alexeys place. Thanks Cris for this bottle Clear yellow-golden with a white head. Faint fruity aroma with a bit of paper and a bit of bubblegum. Sweetish flavor with graininess, mild tartness, light fruitiness, a bubblegum note, and a drier finish. Quite light-bodied. Not too flavorful, but quite drinkable.
Klares goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, hefig, leicht fruchtig, würzig, sehr spritzig.

Aroma: Medium toasty, banana, 
Appearance: Brilliant gold body. Massive white head. Good retetion.
Flavour: Medium banana, clove. Medium-light bitterness. Medium-dry finish.
Mouthfeel: Medium-light, creamy body. Medium-high carbonation.
Overall: I am missing the clove aroma, but flavour of the beer is great.

500 ml bottle, poured.
15A. Weizen/Weissbier

Bottle. Pours crystal straw with very good head. In aroma bubblegum, banana, no clove. In taste lightly sweet, bit citrusy with banana and gum flavours. High carbonation, dry and low bitter finish. Ok.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Bottle - clear lemon with large head slowly disappearing to thin white head. Strong carbonation - strong banana aroma, smooth in mouth and on tongue. Bit thin tasting but refreshing - not as strong tasting as other wheats.
Draft - clear,  golden, high carbonation. Thick white large bubble head. Only light aroma. Ok mouthfeel, smooth, slightly lemony tasting ok but nothing special. 5-4-5-4-12-30.
Bottle at a bar in Berlin. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of light malt, cardboard, light fruit. Flavour is above light sweet and bitter. Light bodied with moderate to high carbonation.
Clear (!) yellow, white lacing, lasting white foam head. Perfect drink for this temperature, light citrus aroma, crisp fresh tast. (Ouddorp 201508)

Appearance: crystal clear pale straw with a fat finger of rocky white head diminishing gradually to a thin cap, spotty lacing. (3/5) Aroma: muted, light wheat, banana, bubblegum. (6/10) Taste: moderate sweet, mild bitter. (6/10) Palate: light body, moderate carbonation, off-dry crisp finish. (3/5)

About what I expected for such an aggressively polished beer: the filtration seems to have stripped out some flavour, resulting in flavours and aromas being somewhat muted. Still pleasant, but it could stand to be more emphatic. (12/20)

Aroma is sweet grain, clove, banana esters, and citrus. Taste is very light and sweet whats and citrus. A light bitterness remains at end. Appearance is a clear straw with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

Pours perfectly clear golden color, topped with a fine white head. Familiar aroma of wheat, bananas and some gentle spices. Taste mildly sweet, wheaty with some mild final bitterness. Some gentle soury feel in the finish as well. Nice one, a bit more gentle take on weizens but nice.

Lyst strå med høyt skum som forsvinner raskt. Lett sitrus, hvete og noe krydder i duften. Smaken følger duften. Både lukt og smak er for lett og flyktig formin smak, men ølet er friskt med en tørr avslutning.

500ml brown bottle from Erdinger mixed pack. Gold colour, clear (of course), fat and rocky white cap that sticks to the glass nicely. Nose has light spice, wheat, gum. Taste sweet and toasted wheats, fruity. Nice finish with spice and fruity yeast notes. Good carbonation and lightish in body. Failry good.

Aroma: bubblegum, cloves, bananas
Appearance: huge white head, clear golden
Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: medium body, slick feel, lively carbonation, dry finish

Very nice
@ Agards väg 17/7-15. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty with some fruity and spicy notes, also light notes of banana and wheat. Body is light, the finish is dry.

Pours a pale golden colour, with a thick, foamy white head. Good retention, bubbles vigorously. Aroma is yeasty, doughy, with hints of coriander and clove. Tastes like malt, wheat, slightly earthy, with underlying hints of citrus. Body is light, texture is thin and slick, carbonation is vigorous. Finishes crisp, with faint, lingering spice notes. Pretty nice beer for a hot day on the patio.

Bottle; nice to be able to pick up one of my least tried styles at Bevmo (at least until Joe adds Turnip Ale, of course). Pours, well, crystal clear orange, medium white head, dissipates slowly leaving good residual and lacing. Aroma is wheat, lemon and cardboard. Missing the banana clove thing of a normal Hefe. Flavor is light sweet, very light bitter, wheaty, lemon, a hint of banana. Medium light body. Meh

Bottle.
Yellow, heavy white head.
Arom of aluminum can.
Taste of nothing, but ok on warm summer days.

Very boring. But is a kristallweizen....Pours a clear bright golden straw with a thick white head, steady carbonation. No lacing. The aroma is mild, citrus with spicy and grassy hops. Nice light toasted wheat and bready malts, floral and light citrus. Crisp, clean and refreshing with a light spice note and a bit of banana

Dorada media. Muy muy espumosa (4-5 dedos). Aroma pobre, algo frutal. Sabor que disimula bien su naturaleza de trigo (podría pasar por lager), pero quizá excesivamente dulzon y por tanto cansino. Limpia y suave (propias del estilo). Bastante bebible.
Like the cris carbonated flavors. Very clean but lacks some of the nice weizen flavors. Lacks the traditional snap.

Bottle from Tesco. Pours clear golden. Nose is sweet malts, light cloves and spices. Taste is fruity, very light wheat notes and spices. Quite high carbonation. To be honest, in blind tasting I wouldnt even know this was a weizen. Boring asmany kristalweizens.

Bottle. Clear golden, big white head, slowly dissipating. Fairly faint aroma, discreet fruity smell, minimal wheat touch, even after swirrling the glas repeatedly. Taste is discreet, with a fruity character, banana, wheat, citrus, breadish but still not very flavourful. Light to medium body, high carbo. Easy to drink, no off flavours at least.

Its amazing when you find a near perfect beer- all those others you ratwd so low, now people know what youre talking about! This is served un a priper glass and has huge lingering head and fierce carbonation with a golden body. aroma is yeast and hops that comes across as coriander complexity. flavour is smooth malt with a lingeeing hoppy finish
 so simple but very well done. i wish some bolivian macro brewers. would come here for research.
Flaska. Klar gul med ett stort vitt skum. Malt och vete i aromen. Vete, malt, gräs och svagt av citron i smaken. Krispig munkänsla. Boring.

L:
-pours a clear golden colour with a big fluffy white head
-crazy amounts of carbonation rushing up the glass
S:
-very grassy,earthybubble gum,cardboard and a slight banana aroma
T:
-very grassy,honey,bubble gum,slight banana w a sweet, bready finish
F:
-medium-high carbonation,light-medium mouthfeel
O:
very different flavour profile as other Hefeweizens.
at times it tasted more like a Pilsner than a Weizen.
Not quite what i want from the style.
Clear golden color. Aroma is not as fruity and yeasty as the normal Erdinger weissbier. Quite bitter taste. Medium body.
Bottle, 50 cl. Well balanced, smooth. Not that prominent citrus. Medium carbonation. Nice to thai food at home.
Clear golden with big white head. Quite herbal and spicy, light cloves, curry, oregano. Light sweet taste with very light bitterness. Medium bodied with a bit watery feel. Bland.
Bottle @Augusta, WF. Clear light golden colour with big white foam. Aromas of wheat, yeast, spices, hint of banana. Taste has hops, banana, spices, vanilla. Mellow and enjoyable!

Bottle from Tesco, Prestwich. Amber with a frothy head. I didnt have the proper glass available as it got smashed a couple of years back - looks best in that! Had this many times in Germany though. Theres wheat tastes here but a fair sweetness as well. Has a potent nose with a light fruitiness in its flavour with banana very evident. Easy drinking with or without the added zitronen.

Really mellow and smooth. Wheat is perfectly light in the mix and just hints at phenolic sourness. Doesnt smack you round the face with flavour but it does have a subtle intrigue. The finish has some flowers and apple. The fizz is forgiving too. Nice. Was expecting it to have a higher rating on here.
How : bottle Appearance : clear light golden, medium white head. Aroma : banana, orange peel, spice, floral. Palate : medium to light body, lively carbonation.
Bottle - big pillowy head, clear light straw color, light wheat aroma and flavor, fuller bodied than expected, mild earthy and fruity hops, pretty smooth finish, good overall

Relatively weak aroma, and not very easy to pinpoint; a mixture of hops, metal, stables, and bananas. Clear, piss-golden; the head large but short-lived. Sweetish, hardly any bitterness or sourness at all. Body medium; sparkling; weak, sweet-sourish and a bit astringent finish. Will do as a table beer.

Bottle at Churchkey. Pours a clear golden orange color. The pour was the traditional upside down pour seen with Hefeweizens. Aromas of grapeskins and earthy light hay notes. Taste is sweet and well balanced. Refreshing beer and a style I have never experienced.

The aroma is banan, noble hops. 
The appearance gold, slight Amber, clear, white head. The flavor is hoppy, spicy, light grainy. The finish is hoppy, light banana, grainy. Like its hefe cousin, over hopped for the style. Medium in body. Odd, just like the regular hefe.
Unassuming German Wheat Beer that goes well with pizza and looks awesome in a tall half liter glass. A beer an old crummodgen would enjoy.

Bottle from Eltham WInes, Eltham. Gold pour with a fluffy white head... lots of life in this one. Aromas of banana, vanilla and fresh herb. Flavours of vanilla, light malt, peaches and cream. Creamy malt finish. Not too bad.

Brilliant clear golden with a classical German fluffy white head. Wheaty and clean nose with notes of wheat toast and clean german pale malts. Lovely, transportative flavor of clean biscuity german blonde malt, clean wheaty toast, and a summertime crisp blonde note on the finish. Tastes like Im in Dusseldorf on a patio, and not in my livingroom in Denver.
hay, banana, bubblegum, pale, clear, frothy, rocky head, light sweetness, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 As Erdinger Kristall. Very pure and deep golden blonde colour, cristal clear as expected, with very strong, almost champagne-like, beautiful fizz; very thick and frothy, rocky, lacing, cream white, pompous head retaining well. Grainy and wheaty aroma, a bit sourish, grassy, hints of sourdough, apple peel, cava, lightly toasted bread, pear, kiwi, wet paper, bitter honey. Crisp and fruity taste, sour berries, starfruit and unripe peach, somewhat oily, smooth mouthfeel with strong, fizzy, minerally carbonation, a bit cava- or prosecco-like brut flavour, clear and refreshing wheat sourishness lasting till deep into the finish, where it is accompanied by a soft and pleasant bready maltiness and a subtle hint of grassy hop bitterishness providing structure and balance. Not very complex, as is usually the case with these filtered Weizens, but very decent for its style, refreshing and just fit for a sunny spring afternoon like this.

0,5 l bottle. I will never understand, why we need a Weizen Kristall. Anyhow. Dark golden in the glass and, as expected, clear. Two finger white head. More green apple than banana on the nose. Taste is less fruity, little bit malty, low bitterness. Not really bad.
Bottle. Gold in color. Gigantic, big fluffy head. Aroma was kind of like a traditional German lager. Taste was also like a German lager.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2015 Smooth and fresh Kristallweizen. Not too deep, slightly sweetish with the typical Kristallweizen-aroma. Not too intense, easy to drink with hints of water. No real aftertaste, hints of Kistallweizen-sweetness, no bitterness.

Blonde pâle, translucide. Belle mousse blanche persistante.
Au nez blé léger, épicée un petit peu sucrée banane.
En bouche idem, avec le côté fruité un poil plus affirmé.
Pas mal, mais un peu plate.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2015 Bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a thick white foamy head. Aroma is sweet of bread, yeast and banana. The taste is bittersweet of bready malt, wheat, banana and cloves. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A sweet, bready finish. Refreshing but not exciting.

Bottle, 50cL. Home. A pale golden yellow beer with a big white head ; few bubbles ; good retention. Aroma of cereal, herb, light metallic, spice. Light to medium bitter, light sweet. Light body, thin silky texture, high carbonation, dry bitter refreshing finish. Overall, average OK refreshing wheat beer.

500 ml bottle. Enjoyed at Munich, Germany. Pours a clear golden colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of white bread and wheat. Flavour of harsh grainy malts, wheat, rubber and very mild sweetness. Harsh mouthfeel and high carbonation. No complexity whatsoever. Simple and useless.
Flaska från SB. Ljus klar med vit skumkrona. Svag doft av gröna äpplen. Vattnig kropp med svag smak av skumbanan och gröna äpplen.

large rocky frothy white head. excellent lacing. mostly diminishing. clear sparkling thin dark yellow body. aroma: metal, light hoppy, honey. if: light sweet. ff: light sweet bitter; average duration. palate: light medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. Aroma de pilsen comercial não lembra em nada o de uma cerveja de trigo, mesmo que filtrada. Sabor metalizado, com toques de mel. Lembra uma bohemian pilsener lite. Nada de banana, cravo e outras características weizen no paladar.4 s

Bright golden colour with a white head. Very little aroma. Bready malts in the taste, but not much else. This bright, clear version of a Weissbier is very lacking in flavour compared with the traditional, cloudy beer. There is the merest hint of banana, and a touch of cloves, but this beer is otherwise rather bland. Stick to the cloudy version - it is much tastier!

Clear pale golden color with a medium white head. Aroma is clove with hay and some very slight banana notes. Flavor is bready malts with a touch of phenolic clove and a slight bittersweet flavor. Medium to light palate. Somewhat bland, but refreshing.
Bottle 0.33l at Erdinger stand Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it golden color with medium white head.Taste and aroma of malt, corn and little bit metallic.Not good balanced.
Bottle shared at home. Pours clear with white head. Bread aroma. Flavour is sweet biscuit. Plenty of carbonation. Okay.
While I did kind of enjoy this, I honesty dont really understand the point of this style. There is a little bit of wheat character in there, I guess, It semmed mote like a regular German Lager.

The filtering takes out all that I find special in a Weiss , the flavour lacks any complexity, it looks like a macro lager , and you have to sniff hard to get any of that yeasty aroma. Style ticked, but I will go back to the unfiltered next time.
Botella de 50 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, trigo.
Clear golden with a white head - Some malt in the aroma along with some hints of wheat - Wheat malt flavours with a low bitterness - Wheat and malts goes into the finish - This was ok and refreshing
Big bottle in big glass wheaty aroma big white head tastes is typical German wheat beer good stuff

Poured from bottle clear golden with medium head that settles fast. Aroma light with just subtle tones of banana and a whiff och metal. Taste is refreshingly mild and the high CO2 makes a great summer beer.

Bottle @ Cafe Vingerhoeds, large sample, served in a weizen glass. Clear yellow golden color, big frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, grainy malts, hint of banana. Bit sweet, slight bitter. Like a wheat pils. High carbonation, thin body. I prefer weissbier unfiltered, so with the yeast.

Bottle @ Café Vingerhoeds, Oirschot. Clear golden color, medium to full sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Smell and taste wheat, lightly hayish, lightly bitter. Medium body, medium carbonation.
Bottle. Golden, aroma is sweet banana. Taste is banana, clove, malty, grassy earthy aftertaste. Fair
Gylden brun klar med høyt hvitt skum. Lite lukt, kornete, lett honning og maltlukt. Søtlig mild smak. Medium kullsyre. Kort

Stavanger Øllags Erdingertreff på Cardinal: flott hvitt skum som på de andre ølene denne kvelden. Litt maltsødme men forsvinnende lite aroma. Krystallklar, men hva er vitsen, et av kjennetegnene på gode hvetøl er naturligvis det ufiltrerte utseendet. Iflg salgsrepresentanten bruker Erdinger kun Hallertauer Perle (pellets), men her har de vært særs sparsommelige. Et hveteøl for de som ikke liker stilarten.

Review following the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 15A). Bottle 50 cl - Batch L291107. AROMA: light wheat aroma with faint vanilla notes and a sweet background. no hops, diacetyl or DMS aromas present. APPEARANCE: gold color and translucid (kristall version). average white and moussy head with average retention. TASTE: grainy and bready flavours with faint wheat character. some vanilla notes and finishes sweet. very low bitterness. no DMS or diacetyl. PALATE: medium-low body with medium-low carbonation. OVERALL: a bulk filtered weizen that lacks the aromas and flavours of a standard weizen.

Bottle: clear, deep straw with a bronze edge. Pours with athich head that dissipates quickly. No real lace. Six month old beer. Maybe a little developed. Strong banana lift. Hint of tropicals. Clean but simple. Dry to off dry. Not really sour. Low bitterness. Slightly hollow. Clan simple palate driven by banana flavors. Moderately high CO2. 
Another lawn mower beer.
Tastes like a cross between a weiss and a lager, uninteresting and cloying on the palate

Bottle, from the German Deli in Hackney Wick. Pours very clear, but head soon dissipates. Not much weiss flavour coming out of this - not really any banana/esters/clove etc. - almost more lagery on nose & taste-wise, with a cereally finish. Not one Id drink again.
Clear light golden color, big white head . Aroma of yeast, fruits and malt. Sweat taste with same notes. Very light bitterness in finish and aftertaste.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Very light smell, I just get a hint of fruits when I swirl the glass and shove my nose down in the glass. Mild taste some pale bread and a light fruity aroma. No wheat aromas at all. Very bland and boring beer. But at least no off flavours and it is drinkable.

500ml bottle. Aroma is light hops, light yeast and light grass. Appearance is clear yellow with a huge, fast decreasing white head. Taste is light sour and light bitter. A medium carbonation with a quick, light bitter finish. Good.
Flaska snikad från @msbrindbergs guldfärgad vätska med vitt skum. Svagt jästig söt banan. Helt ok

Flaska från SB. 
Klar mörkgul vätska med ett stort luftigt skum. 
Doftar jäst, bröddeg och skumbanan. 
Lätt syrlig och sträv i smaken. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours clear golden with a small head. Nose and taste has light yeast, banana, clove and some bread.
Lättsam sommar och grillöl. Hyfsat fruktig med en typisk veteton. Bättre eller sämre än den ofilterade - oklart.
Couleur dorée, petite mousse blanche. Nez très léger blé. Gout doux malté et céréales. Bien ronde en bouche, fin céréales.

500ml bottle from Tesco. 
Big bubbly white head disappears quickly, no lacing. Clear golden body. Fruity nose, some sweet citrus and grass. Flavour is banana with cloves, kind of buttery. Quite sweet all round. Clean, crisp finish. Carbonation is high but pleasant, sits nicely on the tongue. Very drinkable.

DWGIB; Bottle 0,5 l. at Schleusenkrug, enjoyed in the garden. Pours clear golden with a lasting, frothy, lacings white head. Nose is light malt, wheat, yeast, sweet fruit, hay, light citrus and light spice. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter, light citric, light spice and moderate lasting. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is avarage.

Bottle from old backlog notes 07. Pours a clear yellow golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have wheat bread, mild banana, light spices, a splash of citrus, flavor is on the mild side. This is another style I dont get.
500 ml bottle. Clear golden with white head. Smell is white pepper and banana. Taste is banana and spices. Low bitterness and medium to high carbonation.

Bottle from SuperValu, Longford [260614]
Golden, clear, huge big frothy white head which dissipates, slight lacing
Aroma of slight pale lager malts, soft sweet, almost nothing, but no off notes
Taste of sweet pale malts, slight light sweet honey, hint of light fruits, only really getting the wheat from the smoothness, rather boring in flavour
Palate - medium carb, light to medium body, soft sweet. Finish as main flavour, soft sweet, rather non-descript
Overall - Wheat beer for lager drinkers...no wonder theyre called castrated hefeweizens - most of the flavour has been knocked out. Drunk as a wheat lager its not too bad.......
@ Röhällavägen. Bottle (500 ml) from Systembolaget (23:-). Light malty and fruity, spicy notes, banana and wheat, quite fizzy, medium sweetness, light body and oily texture. The finish is dry.

Pale beer a light citrus aroma and a perfect, frothy head. Flavour has the citrus too but theres a a blend of biscuit and caramel in there too. Finish is a touch water. The beer is crisp, refreshing and forgettable.

Golden, mild white lacing. Mild citrus and biscuit. Medium bodied, citrus, mild caramel. Refreshing and mild bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden pale color with a medium-persistent white head.

Sweet malt aroma, slightly grassy and hop notes.

Sweet malt taste, with banana hints and citrus, with a soft bitter finishing. Very refreshing.

Weissbier molt filtrada però que manté el sabor, suau i regrescant.
Weissbier muy filtrada pero que mantiene el sabor, suave y refrescante.

500ml bottle. Poured into my weizen glass. Clear golden color. Thin bubbly white head, with good retention. Leaves decent splotches of lace. Smooth, kind of soft, light to moderate carbonation. Light macro-type roughness to the texture. Lightly dry finish. Light to medium body, with a full feel. Bready wheaty flavor, lightly spicy. Hints of banana, not as much as a typical hefe has though. Light spice. Moderate bitter taste, mild bite to it. Moderate sweet. Kind of a mild macro-lager type taste and texture to this holds it back some. But its a reasonably easy-drinking and sort of refreshing weizen overall, still.
Cerveja da família erdinger que uma proposta mais suave ,talvez pensando em dias quentes
Pours crystal clear gold. Big white head and persistent lacing. Taste sweet and bitter. Aroma of lemon and bread. Lively carbonation.
Blond and crystal, initial head is generous but at end only remains half cm. Aroma has some fruity notes, citric and banana. Body is light, average carbonation the finish is sweet.
500ml bottle from Tesco. Pours clear gold, massive white head. Aromas are lemon and cereal. Taste is more of the same. High carbonation. Lacks the body of the unfiltered version.
Bottle. Tart lemon aroma. Light here flavour with a clean finish. Refreshing on a hot day.

A golden yellow coloured beer with a frothy white head. A light wheat beer aroma, there are hints of tropical fruit and spice, but the most dominant aroma is that of the wheat. Dry mouthfeel. A mild wheat, grainy taste tempers the usual tropical and tarty grapefruit citrus fruit and clove spice flavours, giving the flavour a really good balance. The tart fruit flavour becomes more dominant in the finish.

500 ml bottle from Bacchus Wine. Olney. Pale yellow, almost straw with lots of carbonation and a thick creamy white head. The nose is mostly honey and floral with some lemony astringency. Sweet taste with a bit of bitterness in the finish to temper it. This is really nice, a lot nicer than I wouldve expected. Would make a brilliant hot-weather alternative to lager or golden real ales.

Shared a 50cl bottle. Pours a clear hay colour with a white head. Aroma is light with hay, malt and spicy notes. Average carbonation and light watery body. Taste is... disappointing. Overall... I know that kristall tend to be less tasteful, but this is too watery.
Bottle. Clear pale golden color with a thin white head. Mild aroma of grain and hay with notes of lemon. Not much wheat in taste. Thin body.

A scent of citrus, sweetness and bread. The flavor of wheat with a little good bitterness on the side makes this beer very enjoyable to drink. Aftertaste is perhaps a little too thin but the little bitterness makes it pleasant and enjoyable. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
50cl bottle from beercascais. Color is clear. Head is medium and white. Body is soft. Aroma is wheat and cornish cereal. Not bad but not excellent.
Gyllen gyl med medium offwhite skum. Litt hint av korn og banan, ellers lite. Smaker ganske tamt, medium kullsyre, ingen bitterhet. En ganske kjedelig opplevelse...
500ml bottle from Tesco in Windsor. Huge head from indifferent pouring by the wife. Odd fish this. A muted wheat beer coming across a bit lagery.

Aroma of wheat malt, grass, hops, sour candies far behind, hints of yeast.
Tall fruity off-white head soon diminishes to about nothing, on the crystal (kristall - filtered) clear body. 
Tastes sweet wheat malts, sweet lemon, very very small hops.
To palate carbonated, somewhat watery, empty.
Finishes with malts, bread, hops are even smaller now.
Overall good, easy to drink, and unusual variation of wheat beer.

Bottle from trade with Beerhunter111, many thanks. Style #71. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, yeastly, bit spicy, some hints of banana. Taste is malty, yeastly, fruity and bit spicy
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldgelbes Bier, viel CO2, viel Schaum. Geruch hefig, leicht malzig fruchtig. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig, im Abgang leicht würzig.

26th January 2014Bamberg Bash Day 3. Tap at Munich Airport. Bright clear pale gold beer, small white head. Palate is light and smooth. Mild fine carbonation. Smooth sweet pale malt, little floralness. Light finish. Clean but pretty bland.

How: Draught.
Where: Erdinger Sportsbar, Munchen Flughafen.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Banana, spices, grass.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Wheat, banana, spices.

Tap at Erdinger Sportscafe, Munchen Flughafen T2, 26/01/14. 
Clear golden with a big, Mr Whippy-esque, off white head.
Nose is toasty, light nana, bread dough, orange.
Taste comprises light banana bread, spice, wheaten bread, faint orange, grass.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation with a little prickle.
Ok for style, not one Id rush back to.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap at Wir Zwei, Berlin. Pours clear yellow with white head. A lot of carbonation. Wheat and fruity flavor. Watery. I prefer hefe to kristall so not my cup of tea.
Lys gul, medium/høyt skum. Aroma av hvete, banan, gjær og muligens sitrus. Smaker mye det samme. Tynn/medium konsistens, ganske fruktig. Litt tørr.

500ml Bottle from Tesco (£2.19):
Light with some wheat and faint grassy hops, almost coming across as a pale lager in places as apposed to a wheat beer. This soon passes with some citrus and light banana followed by some background malts and bread.

Clear amber to gold colour with a thumb sized head that is full of fairly large, rough looking bubbles that settle to a thing lacing on the top of the beer that starts to turn patchy.

Wheat, malts and banana start things off, with the latter coming through stronger than it did in the nose. There is some cloves, a light citrus taste and touches of bread too, plus some background fruits.

Lively with a fairly good balance and a medium body with a very slightly sticky mouthfeel. The beer was quite an easy one to drink although it did come across as a little bland in places.

Quite a strange beer initially and started almost like a pale lager with light malts and very faint grassy hops before the kristalweizen in it started to shine through. Not a bad effort overall but there are certainly better, and more readily available, Erdinger beers out there to be had.
Quite a sweet beer. Darker gold colour, very crisp and mighty fruity. A bit too fruity for my liking.
Bottle for poker and ticking purposes. Pours regular yellow with bighead. Nose is stale cardboard and grains. Tastes of grain, light hops, wet wood, cardboard, grass, lemon. Refreshing though
Has a fresh and sweet aroma of banana and citrus. Pours clear and golden with a fading white head. Tastes sweet of banana, wheat and with a mild bitter finish.
Banana esters, great color, very dry. Would recommend on hot day, as a lawn mower beer.
Ljusgul lite klarare än vanlig men med skumbanan i doften och klassiska weissbier smaken!
50cl bottle from supermarket in Düsseldorf. Clear golden / amber with a thick white head. Medium sweetness with bitter tones. Grapefruit, tangerine, some banana and wheat. A decent weizen beer.

~Strong floral hop aroma right after poured with some citrus notes, hay and minerals
~Brilliantly clear light gold color with lasting fluffy white head.
~Pear like flavor with very light lemony citrus, hay, and sweet biscuity malts.
~light medium bodied, with high CO2, prickly bubbly feel on tongue. Lasting sweet slightly sour finish.
~Enjoyable refreshing brew, Would love to have these all summer long.
bottle at home ... golden amber ... thin white head ... soft dry fruit nose ... soft fruits ... light banana ... light toffee ... ok

Botte @ home. Clear color and a head that leaves some lacing. Nose is waek and lighter than usual for a weissbier. Notes of banana, hay and a hint of sourness and cardboard, also hints of cloves. Taste is dry, slightly sour with hay, wheat and banana, and a dry banana-peel astringent aftertaste. Not bad, but nothing special.

Appearance: Clear golden/amber with a 3 finger thick white head.
Aroma: Biscuit, pepper, tangerine marmalade, grapefruit and subtle banana.
Taste: Low sweetness, low/medium bitterness and medium sourness.
Palate: Light airy slightly grainy texture, light body, prickly carbonation. Lingering citrus, peppery and malty astringent finish.
Comments: Tasty and refreshing.

Nose is dry, hey, a little cardboard, nothing to it. Appearance is suspiciously larger like.... Taste, dry start leading to a touch of banana and bubble gum. Its like a wheat beer with all the flavor drained out. A genuinely rubbish beer, browsing the other reviews Im surprised by how well like this seems to be by some.

I remember being highly impressed by the first Kristallweizen I tried: Well, I was looking forward to this, and I have to say aroma wise, the typical spicy clove and banana notes fair leapt into the nose, and it looked fantastic: Bright crystal clear with an impressive densely packed white head. However, despite the aroma, the taste was restrained, muted even. A bit of fruity sweetness, and some dry banana, but a definite lack of spiciness. Fizzy carbonation, not so much of a finish, more a petering out. Perhaps would have been better colder, but for me not a patch on the Whiestephaner version.

Poured from 500ml bottle into Weizen Glass. Wheaty aroma. Poured deep gold and clear with a 2 finger white head. Tastes very light and refreshing. Gently sweet and wheaty. Very drinkable, highly recommended.
Bottle from Tesco. Golden beer with medium head. Aroma of wheat and a little yeast. Taste is some yeast, a bit of spice, wheat and some pale malts. Watery. Disappointing.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Not a style that I have had before and not one I will drink often. Pour is clean,clear and a straw/hay color. Aroma is very much like a lager with a wheat. Lite and refreshing but to sweet for lack of body.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 1pt 0.9oz bottle into a weizen glass. The bottle has a freshness date but no abv%.

Appearance: The body is clear, golden yellow in color and toped off with a tall loosely packed head. Most of the larger bubbles settle out quickly leaving a thin creamy covering. This holds on well and makes some slick lacing which slides right down the glass as I drink. 

Smell: Its nose is lighter than most wheat beers but offers some mild fruity wheat with light notes of clove, banana and hop spice. 

Taste/Palate: The flavor starts with a base of light grain and wheat mixed with mild notes of clove and fruity yeast. There is only a slight banana note and mild sweetness. Hops add a nice floral spice and crisp dryness to the neutral finish. On the tongue it has a fairly crisp light feel with balanced carbonation. 

Notes: Its very drinkable with good clean wheat beer flavor.

Bright yellow color with a fizzy white head. Smells almost tangy with a bit a yeast...not much there really. Flavor is a touch watery and a bit of tang. Light clove is present. Fizzy refreshing beer but not awesome by any means

Serving type: bottle

Apearance- Pours a clear golden yellow, with a large foamy white head and light lacing

Aroma- A slight fruit smell and somewhat bready.

T/P- Taste starts out like a lager with a hops and malt, but finishes with a wheat aftertaste. The beer seems to be a little overly carbonated.

Overall- This was not bad; I have others from the brewery that was better. Would not turn it down, but would not go out and buy it again.

Clear yellow color, big, frothy and quite long lasting white head. Pretty weak aroma of banana with some metal. The taste is more of the same, bit like banana flavoured mineral water actually. Refreshing but quite bland.

Clear, lager-colored beer, with a full fluffy head. To bad, almost no aroma present. A slightly bitter taste, and almost no aftertaste at all. To bad, i expected more from it...

Helder, pilskleurig bier met een mooie volle schuimkraag. Weinig tot geen aroma te bekennen, jammer genoeg. Bittere smaak maar blijft niet lang hangen. Ook de nasmaak is niet echt aanwezig. Jammer, ik had er meer van verwacht.
A weissbeer without any of the qualities that make the style good. Flimsy body, sweet, too-bright aroma, bubble gum flavor. The palate is just awful in this, unsurprisingly.

Pour is a clear yellow with a large white head. Aroma definitely wheaty with a bit of clover. Flavor is a bit blander. No real hefe characteristics are here. Kinda a fizzy, malty beer with no real aftertaste. I really dont know why you would want to filter a hefe but if you want to try one I guess this is as good as they get.
Clear, gold color. White, frothy and long-lasting head. Low intensity aroma of malt and banana. Light bitterness. Average carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear golden with a huge white head that slowly settles into a thick foam. Aroma is sweet with citrus, hay, wheat and light spices and banana. Taste is quite sweet with a smooth light bitterness in the background, finish is smooth. A bit bland.
500 ml bottle rated from backlog. Clear golden with big fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus peel and clove notes. Taste of wheat, citrus, caramel and clove
This is not my favourite style. Hefeweizens are much better. Lightly sweet, some flavour. But not as much flavour or aroma or dynamic appearance as typical hefeweizen.

Clear golden straw pour with a white head. Sweet nose of bread and banana. A bit sugary, some clove, yeast, and citrus. A bit lemony. The flavor is bread, banana, light clove, and yeast. Lemon and orange peel, yeast, and a touch of water.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 I have to update this rating. This used to be my favourite beer being in Germany. Now I realize  its not a masterpiece. Still its very good. Outstanding balance. Pleasant estery spiciness. Medium body what is rather exceptional for the style. The point is delicious.

Fin gyllen farge, lite skum. frisk duft. frisk smak litt syrlig men ikke mye.
Friskt og godt lettdrukket sommerøl.
Lett lys farve med lyst skum som ligger. Fruktig lukt. Fruktig lett søtlig smak. Moderat bitter. Vinmonopolet.
Smells like recently wet straw. I lives up to its name if is filtered to a crystal clear gold. Light and fizzy not much comes though until the malt wheat finish. A classic example of a classic beer.
Wheat beer lacking the typical foam banana. More grain in the taste. Easy to drink.

I liked this beer, and I think it;s quality is great. However, the fact thats its a kristall weissen and not a heffe-weissen made the color more transparent in the glass. Moreover, the taste was not as rich as Erdingers heffe-weissen (since kristall is filtered wheat beer). Nonetheless, this was a very nice and light German beer. And like some have commented, a bit citrus in the taste, but I couldnt totally make out a wheat taste.

500ml bottle into a weizen glass.

Pours a crystal clear gold with a huge fluffy white head. Unfortunately, the head retention is quite poor and it also leaves not a trace of lacing as it fades.

Aroma of orange peel, lemon, and a hint of caramel and toast. A tiny bit of clove and bubblegum as well.

The flavors are somewhat muted but there are notes of orange and clove along with more caramel. Mouthfeel is very full and slick as is typical for the style but the finish is a bit of the sticky side. Nice lively carbonation.

Overall, a decent wheat beer but far from the best I have had. Nice to pick up every once and a while for a change of pace.

Bottle. Looks like a regular lager color but has a huge head like Weiss .flavor kind of dull. Don't think this is really like a wheat

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Irma, Copenhagen - Clear golden yellow pour with with a medium dissipating white head. Sweet fruit notes, wheat and sweet grainy malt. Slight citrus, some banana notes. Very refreshing/satisfying on a hot day like today. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear yellow pour with low white head. Aroma of light bread, hay. Light bready taste. Light body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear, yellow/golden. Nice frothy head and sticky lace. Nose of subtle wheat, light banana sweetness and subtle pear maybe. Medium bodied, effervecent, semi-sweet with nice wheat character
Flaska från Systembolaget. Ljus vätska med högt skum. Inslag av banan och maltsötma i arom. Smak av gröna örter och en svag syra längst bak
Obefintlig smak av humle, malt, vete, jäst. Syrlig, frisk med lätt sötma. Tunn kropp och eftersmak.

500ml bottle from Beer Hawk - beautifully bright golden amber, clear body, thick frothy white head. Thin nose of banana and clove, similar taste, but quite fizzy. Clear finish, a bit sweet, but not bad...

Refrigerated 16.9 oz. brown bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours beautiful bright clear golden with big bright white head.  Light body, medium/hight carbonation, and estery aroma.  Taste is clove and banana.  Really good kristal.  For me the best Erdinger for the style; would like to try this against some other kristals.

Poured from a 500 ml bottle thanks to weihenweizen. Clear light copper pour with a white head of foam. Decent retention. Aroma has a lot of nice esters coming through, as does the taste. Very light bodied. I like this beer much more than my other Erdinger experiences. Thanks for sharing this, David.
As expected, chrystalclear with white foam. A nice smell of sweetness. medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, fizzy, long, sweet finish.
On tap at Casa Nostra, Marburg... Uninspiring clear color, head is okay... Weak aroma, watery and boring Weizen flavor... Absolutely not my kind of beer

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from Wegmans Leesburg.  It pours a clear light gold color with a pillowy white head.  The nose smells slightly of clove and wheat.   Slightly sweet on the palate with a slightly oily mouthfeel.  Notes of clove, wheat, a slight metallic note.  I wouldnt mind a little more crispness.  Still, its very drinkable, just not very dynamic.
Pretty good but the dark one is actually more interesting. Not so much taste in this one.
Bottle at home. Great expectations, big disappointment. Definitely not my beer style.
500ml bottle, pours clear golden yellow, refreshing taste and highly carbonated, pleasent sweet and fruity aroma with a similar taste.

Clear golden yellow with a thick bright white head and nice lacing. Grainy malt, banana, citrus and spice on the nose. Flavors are similar, with the malt sweetness undercut slightly by a flowery hop bitterness. Light body, lively carbonation and a clean finish.

Gold and truly crystal clear with a lasting rocky white head. Grass, malt and spice are the telling aromas. Light spiciness (less than expected) and some malt/wheat are the only real noticeable flavors. High degree of carbonation. Crisp, clean and very lager-like.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a fizzy and crackling white head that leaves a bit of lacing. Mild aroma with notes of citrus, banana, peach, pear, light grain, light wheat. Taste is medium sweet with no bitterness. Medium body, watery to oily texture, lively carbonation. Finish is sticky sweet. Low on aroma and unpleasant finish.
This isnt bad, but nothing I would recommend. Taste and aroma are okay for the style. [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2013 Aroma of banana, clove, apple/wheat, light gum, light noble hops. Appearance is rich gold with sticky, ever present white head. Flavor comes out with some tangy sweetness (almost reminiscent of sorghum) and really kills all the other yummy character this style should have. Palate is medium, thick and soft. Some flaws going on here, as my bottle said it was good until 07/13.
500ml bottle. Yellow body with a huge crown. Wheat, citrus, grain and some herbs. Low bodie, kind of watery.

A big two and half fingers of head on a hazy, straw colored body. Looks great.
The aroma is banana bread and orange, faint overall.
The taste is moderately bitter with a light fruit sweetness and a banana finish. 
Crisp texture with moderate carbonation and medium body.
This is a great kristalweizen.
Var för några år sedan min favorit. Inte druckit den på ett tag nu. Blev besviken...... Gul men mycket skum, som dock avtar väldigt snabbt. What ever, den sög !

Pours yellow with high foamy white head
Aromas of lager like malts, some wheat, hints of citrus
Fresh wheat taste. Perfect for a warm summer afternoon. Low bodied, bit watery, low bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Nicely drinkable but nothing more

500mL bottle purchased at Total Wine in Sacramento.  The aroma has some banana, and clovey ester character present.  Light floral, light cereal, but the aroma is mostly dominated by the banana.  Transparent golden-yellow body with a pretty frothy, medium white head.  Decent lacing, decent retention.  Starts with a lightly tart, almost astringent note.  Some light mineral character is present, before the wheat flavor and yeast esters seem to come in pretty strong towards the finish.  A bit metallic later on.  Decent.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with abundant but unstable white head. Clear aroma of hop and grain with a citrusy note in the long nose. Sweetish aroma of hop, yeast and grain. Round finish. Not bad.

0,5 l bottle.   BB 05/13
bread, citrus, cereal, dough, golden, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly-medium sourness, medium body, thin feel, slick feel, lively,

A pretty pleasant beer. Aroma is pear, apple and a touch of banana. Appearance is golden-yellow straw colour with a clean white head. Taste is sweet, maybe a touch of bubblegum with some banana and apple, but nothing strong or overpowering, all extremely subtle. Palate is sweet and clean with the mildest of bitter feeling. Not a bad beer, not amazing or anything, but better than most commercial rubbish where I come from.
Postupně sem budu doplňopvat piva, co jsem vypil a zapsal si, chvilku to asi bude trvat a proto k těm dříve vypitým pivům nebudou ádné "dojmy" .

Hate is a very strong word. I absolutely object. Why hate? Because Im not placated by mediocrity? You should vibe on that for a while. Kristallweizen. Pretty much like a Kolsch to me. Getting no bananana. Should I? Do I wish I did? Maybe a hint would be pleasant.
Huge white head, clear golden colour. Nasty aroma, bitterness mixed with rotten eggs. Neutral, watery taste and no palate. Really disappointing compared to the greatness of other Erdinger beers.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Usually I like that kind of beers. But this one disappointed me from first to last. For a kristall this one is dull, nearly tasteless with missing aromas of at least hops. Simple and disappointing.

#853
 Selten so ein goldenes Kristall gesehen. Leider ist der Schaum schnell weg. Aroma? Nicht wirklich, vielleicht einen Hauch säuerlich. Der Antrunk ist dann sehr leicht und eine weitgehend geschmacksneutrale Kaltschorle durchfließt die Kehle. Alles was ein echtes Weizen ausmacht fehlt hier. Der Abgang ist noch mit das beste, denn der ist eher herb. Brauch ich nicht wieder!
	
Test vom 24.2.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 10,6,8,9,9,8 - 8,10
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Taste is really watery and week, somehow dull and non-saying. Flavour of watered hops with some slightly yeast hints. Not to recommend.
Golden colour with a white head. Moderate sweet wheat and som fruity notes in the aroma. Weak flavour with some wheat and grassy notes.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]

Bottle 500ml @ Sommerhus
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, yeast and floral. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Poured with an off-white foamy/sudsy thick head - as thick as the 500ml glass was tall! Head collapsed quickly to a clear light gold colour. Laced well. Aroma of soft sweet grain malt. Taste of grain malt followed by a hint of citrus. Light body. Soft finish.

Pours a crystal clear golden yellow with a small quickly disappearing white fizz.  Aroma of banana, corn and grass grains and a small clove.  Taste is light and nicely carbonated.  Banana esters and clove cling to the palate and it finished with great grass and straw malts flavours.

Head: enormous, white colored. Color: yellow orange. Aroma: almost none, citrus, fruit. Taste: sweet, honey. Palate: smooth, some bitter, medium body, lots of CO2. Overall: very nice.
Bottle. Pours a pale gold colour with a big fluffy white head, wheat and spice in the aroma, not much of a wheat taste, but a long dry finish.
Aroma is light bananas, bread and a hint of fruit/citrus.  The flavor is bananas, bread and fruit and tartness/sourness in the finish.
Pours in cristal clear. Nice malty aroma with some citrusy taste. Palate is mellow and very easy going.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden.
Big white fluffy, semilasting head. Clear light  yellow color.
Small aroma with both citrus and banas but no clowes. Lightly sparkling and clean taste but no typical wheat caractair.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with huge, firm, creamy, white head. Wheaty, slightly grainy and minimally strawy aroma. Taste is initially a bit watery, has minimally sweet wheat malt, a carbonation supported moderately spicy touch in the middle part, more malty notes again in the end with some hay overtones and a hint of citrus.

From a 500 ml bottle it pours a clear golden color with an aggressive ivory head and abundant lacing. The aroma is primarily wheat and maybe some floral notes - no banana flavors here. The taste is was a bit of a surprise after the wheaty nose. Subdued grain greets the pallet along with some yeast flavors. The mouthfeel is medium and extremely smooth. Id drink it again, if someone else bought it.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My first crystal clear hefe-weizen.  From the bottle to a tall wheat glass.  Aroma is spruce and piney and citrus and floral, much more like a Belgian wheat than a German wheat.  The typical banana aroma is a no-show.  Taste is sweet and again taking on the characteristics of a Belgian wheat tripel.  There is the slightest hint of banana, but it just doesnt stand out like the typical German hefe-weizens.  Carbonation is slightly on the prickly side with large bubbles.  Overall, it is a good brew, but not what I was looking for.  I appreciate the creaminess and the banana-like qualities of German wheat, but this one seems to have all that stripped away possibly by the filtering.

500ml bottle pours a clear dark golden color with a 2 finger white head that retains quite well and leaves some decent lacing.  Aroma is banana and wheat with some spicy hops and mild yeast.  Taste is malty sweet with light fruits and mild yeast with some spicy hop bitterness.  Light to medium body with loads of carbonation leaving a nice tingle on the palate.  A very refreshing wheat brew with a cleaner finish than most hefes.

Pours a clear thin copper with a white head that fades into some moderate lacing.  The aroma has some subtle hints of fruit in it but otherwise bland.  The taste is pretty unremarkable but pretty well balanced.  Theres nothing fabulous going on with this beer but it is smooth and quite drinkable.  Theres a little bit of sweetness in there with not much else going on.  Ok
From old backlog. Golden colour with white head. Not as good as unfiltered, but still quite refreshing.
Perfect for dinner! Enjoyed best with grilled meat on a hot summer day. The flavor has a less clear yeast taste as the Hefe due to filtering, but the light malt sweetness and flavor are retained.

500 mL bottle bought at the Vale Brewery in Brill, poured into a pint glass at home.  Dark golden, very fizzy, with a good foamy head on it.  Aroma is malty with a bit of wheat and hops.  Light, wheaty and fresh, with a hint of banana.  A bit like a British golden ale, with less bitterness.  Reasonably tasty, but Id rather have Erdinger Dunkel.

50cl bottle. Golden colour with a white head, creamy and with a good lasting. Aroma is mild malty and with slight banana notes. Flavour has citrus notes with a smooth final, not bittery. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium.
A very solid weissbier. Smooth, bubbly, flavorful light bodied and very drinkable session beer.

Som en tysk krypskytt ligger det något och lurar i den här brygden. Det är nåt som vill ut men tyvärr kommer det inte fram hur väl man än vill. Att den sedan nästan är grön i färgen är bara en pluspoäng, det har många krypskyttar genom tiderna varit.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow with thick, fizzy white head; good retention and lacing. Aroma is citrus fruit, sweet malt, wheat, spice, and light floral hops. Flavor is medium sweet malt and fruit esters with light hops; crisp finish. Light body, warmth, and carbonation.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours clear golden with a white head. Very little aroma, wheat, malt and fruits with a hint of spicy hops in the end. A bit to fizzy for my liking, and too little flavour. Drinkable and somewhat refreshing, might work on a hot summer day. I dont understand for whom this beer is made. It seems like its made for people who dont want hazy beer and are not especially fond of the taste of hefeweizen. Im not one of them.

Bottle 0,5l. Golden Colour, white head. As expected it has a weak taste and smell compared to other weiss beer I have had. Aroma: Soft herbs, yeast and barley. Taste: sweet, malty, bread, spices. Very easy to drink beer, but reminds me more of a pilsner than a weiss beer though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden yellow pale clear with white medium head, set quick quickly. Aromas malts, fruits, some orange, hints of yogurt. Palate is watery medium full mouthful, carbonation smooth and mouthful. Taste is berries and malts, with some wheat notes, apple and cough medicinal after taste. Finish is refreshing, mild, and malty sweet. Kristall tastes quite different from Hefeweizen, has less flavours and thinner palate. Not bad, yet average.
cooked vegetables, earthy, grass, cereal, amber, cloudy, rocky head, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter,
Bottle, it gave me a lot of head and it lasted for a long time, lots of fruit taste in the beer and clear as regular beer. Like this taste.
some not lasting head, golden and clear( !) Nose with light grain, a little lemon. Medium doby and length. light taste and not much wheat character.

16.9 oz. bottle from Table and Vine for $3.99. Best before date: 04- 2012.  Served in my Hacker- Pschorr Weizen Glass. Clear yellow with massive Co2 producing full 1 inch head that lasted until finish. Excellent presentation on this. Nose of clove and wheat. Taste has wheaty yeast with some malt showing in the finish. Does its job being refreshing. However, I dont pick up much banana or clove flavors. To me its like a wheat Pilsner. Still wheat lovers should find this respectable. Tho, not real true to its style.

Bottle by 09-2012.  Nose reminds of effervescent sparkling wine, fresh and zippy.  Dull but clear golden body with a sudsy white head.  Taste of wheat, very faint mineral and metal content, neither malt nor hop contribution is mealy or stale, which is a relief, though the sense here is that some character has been neutered out from their standard wheat beer; indeed, theres very little of the normal phenol or ester compounds.  Lightly bready aftertaste.  Strong crisp body pulls from medium to full.  Clean and, indeed, sparkling - one of the better KWs in a style dominated by failures.

500 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours clear golden with a big fizzy frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some trace on the glass. Smell is sweet with perfume, banana, plums,lemon peal, cilantro and yeast. Taste is sweet, metallic and malty with banana bread, yeast and a chemical perfume-like sweetness. Finish is sweet with yeasty esters and sweet fruits. Weird and not very good at all.

Bottle. Pours clear golden with a big white head.  Aroma of fruitiness, a hint of banana and wheat. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some wheat and banana. Medium body, average carbonation. Somewhat boring beer.
Lätt brödiga och persiko-/nektarin toner och en släng banan i doften. Ger en metallisk känsla. Klen kropp och avsaknaden av arom är påtaglig. Slutsats: Veteöl...nja..typ lageröl.
Very light in flavor with flavors of flowers and fruit. Light yellow in color with a white head.

Bottled. Pours golden with huge white head. Smells fruity and fresh. Tastes sweet fruity with no real finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ar: Spicy, coriander, yeast, Corn, spices, bread.
Ap: golden colour, big Whitney head. 
F: sweet, malty, bread, spices,  raster full bodied.
M: average.
T: Middle of the pack, sort of castrated, pref hefes.

Bottle. Golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish aroma, light fruitiness. Body is light to medium, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, some fruitiness and light banana. Finish is short to average, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish, faint fruitiness and light banana. Lightly sweetish and light-bodied weizen.
Watery, some hints of wheat and hops, but not much. A lively beer with loads of carbonation, but it does not stay long. Go for the Hefe Weissbier instead, a much better weissbier.
Lager like colour...watery texture, active carbonation...small white head...hints of wheat

Biergarten Haus, DC 500ml ($8): Pours a yellowish color with a white head. Aroma is lightly of banana and clove. Taste is rather sweet (perhaps a little bit too much for me). Some subdued dry hops. Very wheaty, and not very complex. I guess this was roguhly what I was expecting. In any case, this is my 100th beer rating from Germany!

Sparkling golden champagne colour, white head. Aroma of Weissbier, but with a lot less banana. Weizen malts, very fresh. Slightly sweet flavour, light bitter. Quite dry finish. Nice.
(From 0,5L bottle @ local bar in Berlin)
50 cl bottle from gormelys centra just says Kristall on front of bottle. again a lovely wheat beer. expensive but worth it
5.33% gold colour with a thin head, good wheat beer aroma and taste, very much line the Hefe but not quite as good.

Jag har kommit till insikten att weissbier är jävligt trevligt öl att dricka, dessutom funkar det lysande som smaklöksnollställare(?). Dessvärre kan jag tycka att de är varandra alldeles för lika, vilket innebär att jag aldrig druckit någon dålig weissbier men jag har inte heller druckit någon fantastisk heller. Hur som helst är det här en förträfflig weissbier med en ton av citrus och vad jag tror är jäst, trots att det är en weissbier kristall.

Bottle at øldommertasting.
Golden and clear with a tall white head. Aroma light malty (wheat, bread). Flavor light sweet, light bitter, dry ending. Light body, heavy carbonated.
Nice golden color with huge risky white head. Very faint aroma of wheat, some banana. Wheaty banana taste. Watery, very carbonated. Rather blant.
