text: Fresh and vaguely metallic malt scent with some citrus aroma. The taste is very fresh with a good hops bitterness. A little dry, rough and sour aftertaste. Nice but the "Hefe-Weizen" i better!

0,5 l. bottle from a supermarket, Deep, clear golden colour, with a big, white head. Wheat and malt aromas, more subdued than the ordinary hefeweissen. High carbonation,that keeps the mouthfeel super crisp. Light sweet taste with notes of wheat and light malt and some  hay notes in the finish. Ends dry with a little bitterness and just a little yeast. Very nice and refreshing beer indeed, but the normal hefeweissen offers more body and flavour.

Half liter bottle at Cardinal. Clear, sparkling golden with a creamy, white, thick film. Banana, light malts and hay on the nose. Light syrupy texture. Medium body. Heavy carbonation. Sweet, paper and wooden bitter and also light acidic flavors.

Sampled on 9/4/2011. This German Kristallweizen pours a medium orange gold color from a .5l bottle. Medium to large sized white foamy head. The aroma is wheaty and cereal, with some citrus and spiciness. A light to medium bodied Kristallweizen. The malts are cereal and grainy, with some sweetness. The hops are citrusy and spicy. Decent carbonation. Light and refreshing with a nice crisp dry finish. A touch of banana and clove as well, but this beer is mostly about the citrusy character. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean, crisp and dry. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.

Bottle @ Home. Pours clear light golden with a white head, loads of fine bubbles. Aroma of wheat, sweet fruit, light citruss. Taste is wheat, banana and other sweet fruit, citruss. Thin body, livelycarbonation. Crisp and refreshing, but not really interesting apart from that. 020911

50 cl Bottle at home. August 2011 

Pours liquid golden yellow with a nice large and creamy head. The aroma is sweet with some wheat notes other then that it reminds me of a premium lager. Taste is a bit bland but it doesnt taste bad, some sweetness and some wheat notes here as well but no where near a Hefeweizen. Its refreshing and better then most lagers other then that pretty mediocre.
Klar gyllene vätska inte olikt en lager. Jämfört med sina vetebröder väldigt snäll och smakmässigt snarlik en tam lager utan beska. Nedtonad syra, borttvättad jästighet, men väldigt drickvänlig.

50cl bottle. Pours golden with frantic bubbles and a huge head.  The nose doesnt have much going on initially, then there is something citrus, perhaps lemon. The taste has tangy pineapple, then a citrus finish. The palate is medium in structure and texture with a clean finish. Overall, this is good apart from the lack of nose.

0.5l bottle. This one pours a clear golden body with a few floaters and a massive everlasting fluffy off-white head. Aroma has citrus, hay, oranges, some hints of cloves and a little bit of caramel. It has a oily mouthfeeling, average carbonation and medium-bodied. Tastes OK, but I cant quite wrap my head around the idea to filter and therefore effectively kill off a weiz. It just makes no sense to me.. It has some lager-ish notes of malts and thin caramel, but also some wheat and hints of banana. Ends kinda watery. Not bad, but I think its a bit wrong.
On draught at an Italian restaurant close to Mainz Hbf.  Pours like a pilsener and has a distinct Weizen taste.  Not bad, refreshing but no real depth of flavour.

Not the best of the Kristallweizens and that is particular because of a relatively little Weizen-taste. It does do its job as a refresher very well (which is typical for a Kristallweizen) but the hints of for example banana and citrus (which are very big in the normal Erdinger Weizen) are very low and hard to trace. As a matter of fact it refers more to Classic German Pilssner than to a Weizen but still; is a good beer in itself.

Bottle. Pours a dull clear/slightly hazy yellow, with a big white head. Decent lacing. Sweetish aroma bordering candy, but not quite getting there. Faint notes of yeast. Hops and pineapple as it warms as well as a tart note bordering vinegar. Flavour is fat, malty and a bit grainy. Notes of wheat as it warms. Cereal and metallic finish with a mild bitterness. Okay. 01.08.11.
very good beer not overpowering and nice golden colour.the best beer i have ever tasted.
A good filtered weizen. Not as good as the yeasty ones, but Id take this one over any bulk lager, anytime.
500ml bottle.  Pours orange gold with a large frothy head.  Aroma is yeasty with a touch of lemon and banana.  Taste is bready to start.  Watery, gassy bready finish.

Bottle 50 cl. (label says Kristall)
A clear light pale yellow colour with a high smallbubbly head. A aroma of yeast, citrus and herbs. The taste is sweet. A light body and avarage carbonation.
Bottle 500ml, it pours clear pale golden with large fluffy white head..... aroma is some banana, citrus.... the flavor is fresh, banana, wheat.....nice palate.....

Hier hatte ich mehr erwartet. Im Geruch eher bescheiden hopfig mit leichten Malztönen, geht es beim Geschmack voll in Richtung Malz. Abgang durchschnittlich passabel herb. 
Hier fehlt mir die Spritzigkeit.

500 ml bottle. From mein-biershop.de.
Clear pale golden colour with big foamy head. 
Esthery fruity aroma with mild grassy notes.
Flavour is mildly wheaty and fruity. Not very traditional for a Weißbier, not even for a Kristallweizen. Light and quite fizzy. Some malt/wheat in aftertaste. Easy to drink. Summer drink, and hey, its summer!

A good looking beer: Golden with a huge frothy but shortliving white head, Sweet aroma of bread, hay and grass. Not much evidence of a classic german Weissbier, except for the fact in the mouth theres a small touch of ripe banana. Nice mouthfeel, a little harsh, with a lively carbonation. Hoppy finish. Not bad, quite refreshing, but the style is bland and non-destinct "international" as opposed to classic German Weissbier.
it does the job refreshing beer on a summers day, lags behind the schneider kristall

Schmeckt eher wie ein lasches Pils, obwohl es dafür dann doch ein wenig zu viel Kohlensäure beinhaltet. In keinem Falle ein Weißbier, das es nun wirklich sein soll weiß wohl keiner. 	 
Test vom 9.3.2005, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,7,5,9,8,7 - 7,45

Bottle 50cl, a clear golden beer with huge head and good lacing. Almost no nose. Aroma is slightly sweet, good malty finish, body is relatively light, finish is astringent and cereal like. Hops flavor are low, easy drinkable but quite basic, fruity character are low too.

Bottle. Golden clear, big big big white head. Smells of yeast esters and tropical fruits. Taste is more interesting with banana and citrus. Medium malty body with some sweetness and tiny hints of acids. I like it with a bit more acids than this. Feel is a bit dry and watery. Finish has alot of bitterness. Nothing extreme but alot more than from other weizenbeers like dunkel and hefe. Since this is my first kristall i guess its some of this styles character

Clear, pale, golden, with a soapy white head.  Mild aroma of wheat, citrus and banana. The weak flavor is dominated by faint banana and wheat malt, with perhaps a touch of hops at the end. I was expecting something smooth and refreshing, but the heavy carbonation makes this a tad bit tedious. Slick and bubbly feeling with a light-medium body. Its serviceable.

16.9oz bottle pours a totally clear, straw yellow with a very frothy white head.  Aroma is non existent, lightly sweet, light bread.  Flavor is nicer, sweet, malty, grass, grains.  Medium bodied, sweet finish.

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of wheat, overripe fruits, vinegar, lactic acid and sugar. flavour is wheat and cooked vegetables, with a hint of grain and caramel. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 1pt 0.9oz bottle into a weizen glass. The bottle has a freshness date but no abv%.

Appearance: The body is clear, golden yellow in color and toped off with a tall loosely packed head. Most of the larger bubbles settle out quickly leaving a thin creamy covering. This holds on well and makes some slick lacing which slides right down the glass as I drink. 

Smell: Its nose is lighter than most wheat beers but offers some mild fruity wheat with light notes of clove, banana and hop spice. 

Taste/Palate: The flavor starts with a base of light grain and wheat mixed with mild notes of clove and fruity yeast. There is only a slight banana note and mild sweetness. Hops add a nice floral spice and crisp dryness to the neutral finish. On the tongue it has a fairly crisp light feel with balanced carbonation. 

Notes: Its very drinkable with good clean wheat beer flavor.

Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet and vague with a light banana note. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. This really lacks the typical banana, wheaty and yeasty aromas, and its not as smooth and soft as a typical hefeweizen. 010710

Bottle. Clear yellow with a white foamy head. Spicy noble hop aroma with some lemon, wheat and light hay. Light malt taste with a medium hop bitterness and a very clean finish. Light body with average carbonation and a smooth mouth feel. Great easy drinking beer.

Light straw color; Light to medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, some clove, & light citrus; Flavor of wheat, yeast, clove, light bananas, and citrus; Decent overall - I prefer their hefeweizen.
Bottle at Erdinger Cafe, Munich airport. Beautiful light amber body with fuzzy head. Nose of citrus and malts. Taste really nice of fruits, some bananas toffee and caramel. Nice.

500mL from H St Biergarten in DC. Poured a clear straw to yellow with a giant, bright white head. Infinite retention and massive lace. Aroma is candy corn and air freshener along with old, sweet lemon drops. Taste is suddy, candy corn heavy, adjunct feel with cloying sugar and soap. Palate is watery suddy and chemical. Sometimes a great appearance for a beer can be misleading. Stick to Weihenstephaner Kristalweizen if you are afraid of yeast.

2/24/11. 500mL bottle. "Crystal clear" golden pour with a fluffy white head thats gone fast but lingers as a film. Light sweet aroma of banana and butter with some cream. Sweet light banana flavor with pale malt. Reminds of a solid pale lager as opposed to a filtered hefe. Not bad.
Everything seems subdued form the Original Erdinger. IT is a solid Bavarian style Weisse.

Flaske 50 cl. Gyldne farve, med en høj hvidt krone af middel varighed.
Sød aroma og smag, med noter af hvede. Let drikkelig øl uden kant af nogen art, faktisk lidt kedelig.

Bottle @ home. Clear pale yellow appearance with an off white head. Clean light wheat aroma with a noted lack of yeast or banana. Smooth light bodied wheat beer without many other flavors. Just a light smooth bodied beer thats wheat based.

Very strange to have a filtered wheat beer. Looked like a regular beer. Oh the differerence. Doenst look special, since it looks like a regular beer. Tasty though, and nicely alcoholic, but not overbearing.

Pours clear amber yellow with huge longlived white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is sweet, yeast, bananas, wheat, floral, hops and hay. Crispy fruity mouthfeel. Sourish acidy, wheat, hoppy, yeasty and fruity citric flavor. Flat acidy fruity palate. Finishes dry tart hoppy.

Rating #449, bottle that Amer bought somewhere  

Despite this being my rating #449, this is my first Kristallweizen so I have really nothing to compare it to. This is a medium golden beer with a high beautiful head, and it is actually fabulously inviting. Aroma is a dissapointment though, just grains, and I hope that this is just because it is an Erdinger. Taste is yeast, sweet, butter, sugar, straw, a bit wheat. A real quencher - I wish I had had it even cooler than already. Soft and creamy, quite like some of the wheat ales Ive had in the past. So far, my expierience with this style of beer is not magnificent, but not offensive either. I will be back for more examples of the style.

Poured a clear yellow with a huge white head.  Aroma is malty with wheat and a lot of spices.  Some slightly doughy notes as well.  Taste has a lot of flavor, with wheat, dough, and some floral notes.  Slightly metallic and skunky taste as well.  Finish has some light fruit with hops. Crystal clear (as advertised) straw colored pour.  Lots of carbonation and a fluffy white head rests on top.  Slightly spicy wheat aroma.  A bit of cereal and pepper.  Sligthly sweet wheaty cereal flavor.  Prominant dust yeast notes.  Bitter hop finish. PRetty good summer beer.

Könnyen iható és frissítő, egy sör, mely viszont mindent egybevetve nálam egy közepes/átlagos fajta.

50cl Bottle from REWE Germany, as Erdinger Kristall. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of banana, bubblegum, spicy coriander like notes, cloves. Flavour is sweet, light spicy, a bit of banana, a bit pilsener-like, light spicy bitter finish. Light bodied. Bland.

500 mL bottle from Grape & Gourmet.  Golden pale yellow pour with a white head.  Huge effervesence.  Lager-like aroma and mostly pilsner-esque taste but with a hint of bubblegum to let you know this is still a wheat beer. (500ml bottle bb 01-2010) pours clear pale yellow, nice film of bubbles. Nose of banana pudding, clove, wheat. Taste of banana, sugar, dry spices, with a very well carbonated finish.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2010 I had to try one of these eventually, although the thought of a filtered version of a hefeweissen was admittedly not too appealing. To remove yeast and wheat protein in a process aimed only at making the beer clear - and thus looking more like a common, boring lager - seems like a bad idea to me. I get a lot of clove and banana in the nose, taste follows up in the same pattern but with an almost overwhelming clove dominance which pretty much ruins it for me. Watery mouthfeel. Its also very sweet, reminding me of some twisted form of ginger ale or something, and nowhere near the rich, wheaty, cloudy weissbier that I normally like so much. What a downer. Unless someone makes a particularly good case for me to taste one of these, I think Im done with kristallweissen.

Probably the best kristal weizen beer I have had. It was very sweet and enjoyable, nice head and perfect bubbling.

Light fruit, some malts with a hint of banana and bubblegum.  Very light and easy to drink.  Barely noticed my glass was empty.

Bottle. golden with huge white head. Not much aroma a little hopps and banana. Taste a bit of the same. Gets better in the glass, still I prefer the real stuff. Like a weiss beer for pilsnerdrinkers who doesn´t like weissbiers. A boring style.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow/ripe banana color with clear edges and a 2.5 finger fizzy bubbly head that slowly dissolves. This bear isnt very "clear" at all actually. Its a little less hazy than a regular German wheat beer but is still kind of dark and cloudy.

This is like an Erdinger ligt. Less flavour and aroma and just a bore... At least theres traces of banana...

lighter taste then other products from this brewer. good solid beer, again very consistent, never a poor pint

Erdinger Kristallklar is a pale golden ale that is, in fact, crystal clear.  The white head is huge and pillowy and leaves wonderful fuzzy navel lacing.  The aroma is smart and tart.  The fruity hops smell like theyre from a deep forest.  In the mouth, its a touch thin and gritty.  It belies the soft appearance of the head.  Smooth, nonetheless.  The flavor is simple hops and a light but meaty grain that ends up a bit grassy tasting.  There is a candy-like aftertaste-- like SweetTarts.  Dare I say its malic?  It tastes like a handful of Runts candy-- leaving the banana ones in.  Im fussy with wheat beers but this one is really mature and refined... and crystal clear!

Bottle, Haus der 100 Bieres, Berlin.  Clear beautiful gold pour, rapidly ascending bubble trails through the liquid and a huge 4-finger, small-bubbled fluff of a head. Nice. Spices were noticeably subdued, nearly nonexistent - considering the style that absence has to be taken into account.  Dry finish with a very slight, refreshing after.  Characteristically high carbonation.  Overall, I like this beer just simply because it is a shape-shifter to my normal sensibilities:  a hefeweizen in every way except appearance, this one messes with your mind. Think youre tucking into a pale lager...nope, just a filtered hefe. Weird, but cool in a way. Better than the sum of its parts.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2006 Best Before 03-2006 bottle consumed on 4/13/06Filtered appearance boasts a large, yet manageable white head with a sparkling apple juice-golden colored body.  Head is well-retained, for the most part, eventually receding to cover, with light lacing.Nose smells of cereals, light white grains mainly, and some minor biscuity notes.  Not overly heavy on the banana or bubble gum and very low on clove and other spicy phenols, leading to a refreshingly simple, though moderately sweet (honey, dough) and a pinch of flowery hop notes thrown in.  No alcohol and low on the citrus esters as well.  The nose suggests, mainly, well-extracted and attenuated malts, with reserved yeast bi-products.The flavor is rather crisp up front, snappy carbonation seeing to that, with dry white grain notes, residual dextrin malts filling in slightly on the sides of the mouth.  Correct attenuation though, with just a hint of cideriness from the filtration and age, though hardly anything to complain about.  Warming allows some sweaty notes to emerge, could be old hops or lightly nutty/sourish malts.  Bananas, though dull, stick on the finish, with a bit of wateriness, but the carbonation holds up well, clearing the palate on the finish.  Low/mid gravity session, pale colored beer dont seem to suffer quite as much from filtration and this one is no exception.  I found myself expecting the worst but really not seeing too many negatives from the filtration.  Obviously mouthfeel could be more supple and there would be less wateriness and stale notes, but again, the otherwise well-extracted malts and clean yeast help mitigate this.  Though I have found Erdinger to be rather variable, so I must have got a bottle in great shape.

Bottle. Limpid golden body with average carbonation and a huge white foamy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with some herbal, flowery and banana notes. Taste is mild, well balanced, but it lacks complexity. It carries bready hints. Finish is rather short and thin. Not bad, but this is nothing to impress me.
Bottled. Clear, golden with a diminishing white head and nice carbonation. Weak aroma and flavor of banana and cloves. Guess most of the flavor is filtered away. Ok, but a bit boring. (060413)
Bottle. Yellow- orange colour with a white head. Light banana and fruit aroma. little banana flavour. Too little taste.

50 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Golden clear colour with a huge head. Light aroma of fruit, yeast and bread. Also light flavour of wheat, caramel, acidity and quite more bitter than the original hefe-weizen.

yellow-orange, brass body with large white head, lots of bubbles rising from bottom of glass Aroma is light, banana, lemny/green apple acid too.  Amazing hot weather beer, carbonated, cold, crisp, apples, clove/orange peel/lemon/cranberry. Dry after, a little alcohol and light grains/dough coat tongue and cheks. Really gorgeous dark gold, and head lasts forever and laces well. Flavor matches well. Very refined, well-built, however timid in smell and flavor delivery. Sampled in Cochabamba, Bolivia from a 50CL bottle, purchased at Haas Grocery.
Was a golden color with a large lasting head. Smell was sweet and fruity. The taste was definetly a bitter wheat flavor.

In the bottle at the Hessen Haus during the 2006 Crescent Moon Beer Bus Trip. Clear light yellow in color with an excellent fluffy white head. lacing is present. Nice floral aroma with a subtle banana ester. Tart, lemony wheat flavor. Quick finish.
Bottle.  Pour a golden color with a large frothy head.  Slight fruity aroma, a little yeasty and bitter flavor.  I seen to like the bitter stuff.  This was pretty good.

Smallish white head; clear yellow body with ongoing carbonation. Fruity wheat aroma with hop notes. Sweetish, fruity taste with apple notes and some wheat and floral hops. Soft aftertaste. A bit much carbonation. A decent kristall, but nothing exciting. Not too keen on the concept of kristall in the first place, I have to admit.

Botttle.  Very slightly hazy yellow and orange color with a large billowy head.  Aroma consists of sweet rice and wheat, sweet sugary doughy scents: crisp and light.  Flavor-wise it centers on a semi-sweet lemon, wheat, grains and a very mild yeast flavor.  Tastes almost "husky" at times.  Crisp and somewhat spicy and sharp on the tongue.  Decent German wheat, though not very robust or complex.

Had on tap in Germany (12/9/05).  Golden yellow, mostly transparent, with a thick creamy head.  Light aromas of banana and a hint of lemon.  Banana flavors are weak and slow to develop, but are nice when they come through.  Clean finish.  This beer is nothing special , and a tad too watery for my taste.
Golden colour with a huge mostly lasting white head. Aroma of fruit and lemon. Weak taste for a wheat beer. good palate.
Magnific cristal coloured beer. This german kristallweizen can not get any better, so there is nothing else to say that you will have to try it to experience its incredibly taste.

Bottled, 500ml, filtered. Golden colour with short lasting but volcanic head. Yes it was as clear as a bell, which is interesting for a wheat. Light and thinly flavoured, not much character but nothing off puting either. Its a little sweet with a lemon, grapefruit note and a littlegrass on the finish, a tad too uninteresting for me.

Dead clear and bright in the glass, as per the text book. Big creme brulee-like head upon pouring but settles down quicky. Good lacing. Nose shows some stewed fruit character - a bit worrying but does blow off. - with some generic lager notes. When I first drank the beer the flavours were fairly generic as well, making for a low key / boring beer...but the palate filled out nicely with cloves and spice and more weight as the beer warmed up. Good summer arvo style.

Clear pale golden colour. Long lasting white head. Has a weak aroma of bananas, some citrus aroma aswell. Malty flavour with some banana hints in the background. I miss the hefe in this beer. It is refreshing but it miss something.

Pours out your average cheapo beer pour, light golden, hayish looking.  Aroma of light lemon and banana, a bit grassy.  Flavor is light, very light with a sweet kick to mix in with the fore mentioned aromas.  Mostly blah, but its something new.

Bottle from a Polish Market in Sterling Heights, MI.  Huge billowing white head. Flavor is very mild that is slightly bitter, alcohol undertones, and a sweet.  This wheat beer pours clear now I know why they call it Crystal Clear.  Better than the other Erdinger bottle that I got that I think was bad.  Nice refreshing Lawnmower-esque beer.

500ml bottle.  $2.99 at Broudys, Orange Park FL.  Pours clear pale golden with a big, long lasting white head.  Aroma is strong bubblegum and banana.  Refreshingly crisp and mildly sweet, definitely a summertime brew.  Tropical fruit flavors dominate.  Mouthfeel is light and creamy.  Fairly good, as kristallweizens go, nothing negative here.

This poured with a huge white head, even in my hefe glass. The body is a medium and bright gold. The aroma is peaches and a hint of hay. There is also some tropical fruit, like mango in here. The taste is light with some hay and a little note of banana peel. As others have said, there are no bad flavors here. However, it lacks character of a full on hefe. This is a decent brew that would be good for summertime.

Bottled (BB 05/2006)
Golden color, a big foamy off-white head. Lemony, malty harsh aroma, lacks all the good components of weizen aroma. Medium-bodied. Sugar is dominating flavor, only hints of wheat. Another useless kristallweizen.
Bottle. Clear golden colour. Rocky white head. Mouthfeel is OK, but there is not much wheat flavour in it. Still better than cheap lager...

Bottle.  Pours clear honey gold with a huge rocky creamy off-white head that only slightly diminishes as the time passes; it remains until the end.  Cellared oak wheat malt (straw, hay) aroma with light fruit (banana) notes.  Creamy malt flavor with a light fruit background, well balanced, finish is lightly bitter.  Creamy light body with a fizzy finish.

(bottle) Clear golden colour with a big foamy head. Shy fruity and sweet malty aroma. Medium sweet flavour, medium body. Dense banana fruity taste with a malty background and a slight clovy and citric finish, not lasting but rather sticky. Not very convincing.

(Bottle 50 cl) Golden and clear with a tall head. Very prickling from a lot of CO2, but also rather fresh. A bit hard mouthfeel, not as smooth as your typical Hefe. A bit sulphurous with a very dry finish. 010300

These kristallweizen always seem like the white bread of the weissbier world. Theres nothing objectionable about them but they have little of the flavour or character of a hefe. That said, I think this is one of the better examples. Looked great in the glass: classic spritzy kristall body and the tall, lasting head that seems to be typical of Erdingers brews (even their alcohol-free beer pours with a terrific head). The aroma is lightly fruity but theres not much there to set the nostrils   twitching. Faint banana notes and bubblegum, perhaps some melon. Light in the body but with a creamy-smooth, well-carbonated mouthfeel. Its sweet and wheaty with vanilla notes. However, theres no real finish. Effortless drinking - you could stick away a few of these.

(500 ml bottle: $2.65) I bought this bottle on sale at a Japanese restaurant that had just taken over a German restaurant, so they were trying to unload the German beer and theres no telling how long this beer sat around (it was in a cooler, however).  Amazingly, its not all that bad.  Sweet on the tongue, with a mild bitterness and very little wheat malt flavor, this really comes across as just a basic lager to me.  The very slight cardboard flavor in the background isnt strong enough to be a distraction.  The nose is dry and very grassy, so the sweetness in the flavor really isnt reflected in the aroma.  Light to medium in body, theres enough sweetness that it stays on the palate for awhile.  Dark straw in color and slightly hazy, the steady, swift rush of carbonation bubbles helps keep the tall, bubbly, off-white head going strong throughout the session.  Lacing is sporadic, with some patches spread here and there around the glass.  Overall, not bad, but it certainly could have been a lot worse, especially given the circumstances in which I purchased this bottle.
THis was a clear and fizzy body, with afuzzy head.  Aroma was spice and banan. Nit my fav style, but nice on a hot day.

08.17.05  500ml bottle drink by 01-2006.  Shiny, clear, and effervescent gold with a lofty, brainy white head that lasts clear to the bottome of my tall tall glass.  Aroma is light and fun with banana, toned down clove spice, and pineapple sherbert.  Also some marzapan.  Flavor is nutty, wheaty, with banana and vanilla.  Palate is nothing much, sort of tart and lacks any finishing oomph of driness or sweetness.  Nothing exciting but definitely tasty and refreshing.  More character than the other couple kristallweizens Ive tried.

Clear bright gold in color with a pillowy tan head.  Crisp cloves and pepper in aroma, along with lemons, orange zest and sugarless banana whipped cream.  Flavor is lemon meringue and vanilla crème.  Big flakey biscuit quality and bland sourdough, but not in a bad way.  An earthy sense of coriander spilt on the countertop rounded out with buttercream to take us full circle.  Warm, freshly baked rolls finish.  Fizzy and effervescent and a good choice for a 95 degree summer day.

0.5L into an Erdinger Weiss glass. Clear pale yellow with a huge and thick rocky white head. Malty clovey aroma emanates, although a tad bit subdued. Flavor is malty with some subdued clove in the background. Slight touch of hops. Crisp, and I guess you could say refreshing. Slightly dry finish. A good hot summers day drinker (like today for instance).
user_location: Good Beer Bar Deprived, New Jersey, USA

text: Bottle. Crystal clear yellow in color with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma is hoppy and malty. Grassy hops. Earthy. Spicey. Fruity. Light and refreshing. Hoppy and malty flavor. Fruity and spicey. Finish is dry. Decent beer.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2014 Bottled.  An old gold coloured beer with a big white head and nice lacing.  The aroma is grassy and a bit yeasty.  The taste is dull and watery very much like a lager rather than a weizen.  It is even slightly buttery.  Very disappointing.  Score 2.3Subsequent rating scored 3.4. Average becomes 2.8

Medium gold, good head, perfectly clear as intended.  Faint nose has a bit of wheat and clove.  Flavor is wheat, faint clove, and a hint of banana and bubblegum.  Remarkable how much flavor disappears with filtration.  There is nothing wrong with this beer.  I wish Bud tasted like this.  I would prefer a Hefe almost any day of the week.

Gold. Big, bubbly, yet solid white head. Malt, yeast- smells like a well-made macro. Alcohol also in the nose. Up front the carbonation is overpowering, sparkling spiced wheat in the middle, but the finish is a nice smooth malt flavor. Light body. Nothing exciting, most likely wont buy again.

Pours golden yellow with a thick creamy white head. Fresh, citric, hoppy nose with an herbal spicyness. Flavour from malt & wheat. Sweet, sugary slight yeasty taste. Watery, light bodied. Low bitterness in finish.
Bottled. Golden colour with huge, longlasting white foamy head. Wheat and malt in aroma. Wheat, malt and fruit in flavour. Not too sweet.

(Bottled) Clear golden color with a medium, quickly fading head. Sweetish, buttery aroma - no real signs of a hefeweizen. Sweetish-malty, acidic and fruity flavor with some wheatiness towards the finish. Light to medium-bodied palate with foamy carbonation. A quite plain, uninteresting, not very weizen-like brew.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Yeasty wheaty light fruity aroma and a light sweet fruity taste. Medium body and a sweet finish.

Bottled at DBF 2005.
Clear yellow coloured with a white head.
Fruity aroma with spicy notes.
Fruity flavour with notes of anise.
Boring.
Clear golden colour with a white head. Malty aroma with a light fruity sweetness. Yeasty, spicy flavor with fruit notes.

Golden in colour with a thick offwhite head. Lighht lemony malt with notes of wet dog. Dry malty taste, with fruity banana esters, but the beer has seen better days, as some light cardboard notes are present in this one (about 1 yr old). Still, good little bitterness come out in end, and light alcohol.

Bottle. I dont believe this, finally a kristall that I actually like better than its hefe stable-mate. Looks good on the pour, a clear light gold with a dense white head and plenty of life. On the nose while it is more attenuated in the phenols than you would expect from a hefe, there is plenty of ester (banana) there on top of a good malty foundation. The taste starts sweet and malty as expected, there is a very slight hint of the banana in the aroma, and it finishes with just the right amount of bitterness and a little toastiness. Although it is more subtle than you would expect from a hefe, this is more than made up for by the balance. The carbonation is much better than the hefe version as well, which improves the mouthfeel considerably. This is a very refreshing and well balanced beer.
Good but doesnt hold a candle to the other Erdinger.  Still bloody good though.

500 ml bottle.  Almost clear, slightly translucent golden body, thick lasting smooth creamy head...grassy, faintly caramel-accented nose, touch of lemon...malty, lightly swet body, bit of late sourdough...fairly dull, on the whole.

Tasted from the bottle, into a tall stein. Rose a humungous white head of foam that erupted over the sides of the glass, and lasted til the very end. The body a clear gold, with evident high carbonation. Subtle, almost too subtle,  sweet pasty wheat and banana aroma. Highly effervescent  across the tongue, this has the body of a German pilsner, is quite sweet upfront and refreshingly crisp into the short swallow. Sadly lacking in lactic sourness, yeast, wheat zest and the normally associated  wheat bier esters and phenols. I am no real fan of filtered wheat beers, and this is no exception, but there is nothing bad I could say about it.
Aroma is sourly, wheaty, flowerly. Golden color, o.k. head. Taste has wheat, light sweetness, quite plain. Light grainy and sourly. A bit light, dry finish. Overall, quite tasteless boring Kristall.
UPDATED: FEB 26, 2009 Great Whear Beer.Sweet, fruity taste which  is great for hot days.  Really impresses with the quality of this beer

All looks, not much substance.  Big fluffy white head, clear golden color.  Faint sweetness in the aroma.  some slight banana esters in the flavor with just a touch of wheat tartness and light bitterness.  Quite refreshing on the hot summer day when sampled.

Bottled.
Golden with a huge white head.
Faint aroma and flavour. Sweet and malty.
Not very weissbier-like at all.

Half-liter.  Pours translucent golden with a large, frothy off-white head that is rapidly diminishing and leaves reasonable lace.  Nose is very faint and soapy.  The beer is sweet and wheaty with honey and cinnamon making an appearance.  No alcohol character.  Ends with carbonation and a nice creamy mouthfeel, very slight bitterness.  I dont get much banana, but my last beer was a good hefe, so I may have banana overload.  Not bad.
Bottled(500ml). -golden coloured with huge head, medium body with high carbonation, light wheat aroma with some fruit(banana, lemon) notes, light acidic finish

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2006 From the bottle, this poured a clear yellow color with a modest white head.  The aroma has grass, some banana, cloves, and lemon to it.  The taste is less complicated, mild, grainy, with some banana.  Fairly lively carbonation in the mouth and throat.  Clean finish.  Id rather have a hefe-weizen.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot/DiCarlos Armanetti, Willowbrook, IL<font size=-1>

Light wheat aroma and mild citrus, some bread. Medium amber clear with huge foamy white lacing head. Medium body with high carbonation. Clean start with low wheatiness, no yeast taste. Mild carbonic tang, some citrus. Stale papery hops and mild sweet malt. Overall, pretty watery and not nearly as good as the normal hefeweizen.
Pale yellow, starts with a huge head, diminishing fast. Fizzy carbonation.Light nose -fruity and orange, also yeast and banana but as said not much. Very light and refreshing but boring.
Kind of the like the light beer version of a German Weissbier.  Not too much going on with this beer.  A bit of a cider-like taste.  Move on to a better wheat-beer.

I cant really see the point in filtering a weissbier to remove much of the interest. Golden colour. The esters in the aroma are very restrained, although a bit of banana comes through in the flavour. The finish is citric and a touch acidic. Not much to hold the interest, but OK. 500ml bottle from beersofeurope.co.uk. BBE 30 September 2004.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2005 Tap.  Subtle aroma - only slight hint of bananas and cloves.  Clear tan color.  Flavor nothing special - no distinct flavor other than the carbonation - you can just make out the typical banana/clove flavor if you concentrate.  Granted most Kristalls are bland  but this is one of the blandest.  Okay if you just want a nice smooth beer but not one if you want the distinct Weizen flavor.

Large white head, excellent retention, tiny spotty lacing. Clear straw color. Faintly malty nose with light bananna esters. Light body. light malt and fruit flavors with a touch of oxydation going on. Medium dry finish. Put the yeast back, please?

I cant say that I ever have understood the purpose of filtering a Hefe and getting a Crisatl. To me, you are removing much of the essence that makes a beer special and coming out the other end with a moderate at best product. Such is the case with this version from Erdinger.

This bottled brew poured a large sized frothy head of white colored mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a fair lacing.  The body was carbonated transparent and yellow in color.  The aroma was malty with banana and cloven notes. The mouth feel was smooth with a mild tingly and on the thin side of the flavor spectrum.  The flavor contained notes of mild malts and hops.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Poured a clear golden colour, highly carbonated with a large creamy white head that seems to have made itself comfortable for the evening. aroma is cloves and bubblegum. Taste is the same, sweet and smooth with a good mouthfeel. An instant favourite.
Bottled: Light golden coloured. Clear. White medium sized head. Lasting. Light yeasty and some vague spice notes. Yeast and some earth flavours. Watery. Thin bodied and uninteresting.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2005 Nothing more than an a slightly above average hefe. I suppose the Kristalweizen means filtered, which this was, straw colored. Otherwise, clove, banana, bubblegum taste with a small lasting whteish head.

Bottled. 
Golden. White, cotton-like head. Fruity, vanilla bubbelgum aroma. Clean and crisp, rich in carbonation. Notes of licorice(?!) and(?!) vanilla. A bit dull.
I was sitting out on my driveway sipping away on this one, nothing to rave about but it did set itself apart from the rest, went down smooth
Bottle: Clear golden yellow, with a heavy head. Taste is distinct wheat flavour with a fizz. Its quite light and refreshing. Eventhough I liked it, it still prefer the classic Erdinger Weissbier.

Clean yellow hue with good but fading head and good lace. The aroma hints of subdued citrus, some banana and clove, toasted biscuit, and dusty yeast esters. The taste is mildly fruity and crisp. Clean finish does display some wheat and spice, but isnt very powerful (as is the case with most Krystalweizens). The mouthfeel is lively, clean and crisp, thin. Ovreall, a step up from American Wheats but below the standard hefes I love so much. Worthy of a buy and try.
Kristalweizens don't do much for me. Everything that is different or good about a weizen is filtered out. Comparable to other Kristalweizens however - average.
Great tasting beer. Goes with any type of food. One of my favorite erdinger beers
I thought that this beer was pretty good but I got food poisoning and was in the hospital later on that day so it wasn't that good of an experience.

Huge white head that didn't hang around for long. The aroma was dusty, lemony, yeasty and slight banana. Taste wasn't full but I quite like it, it had some banana, some spice and some clove. An easy drinking weizen for me.

Threw a big head, but ailed to provide much sign of carbonation.  Aroma a touch fruity, but not much to speak of, not the same wheatiness as is present in the heffe.  Al around not as good as the heffe - easy solution is to not bother buying it!

Bottle from the Offie, Leicester. Cack-handed pouring gave me an enormous white head. Pale gold colour, which looks worryingly weak. Sweet, subtle, slightly Battenburg aroma. This is a little disappointing - the wheat flavour is thin and patchy - replaced instead by malt. All in all this is a little too close to lager to be exciting. Crisp and prickly, but that just isn't enough - shame.

Surprisingly, I enjoyed this one. Clear, light-golden lager. Large, fizzy, white head diminishes to a small, well-retained, creamy head. The nose holds some licorice, mint, bisquit and honey notes. Well-balanced flavor. Good 'n' malty, but sufficiently hopped. Light toffee. Medium-bodied with an oily mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Short, crisp, clean finish.
Very light coloured. Banana and yeast in the aroma. Very thin and watery. Yeasty. Bad.
Golden color with a white head. The taste is kind of watery with notes of wheat malts and yeast. It has to be hot for me to drink a lot of these.
Clear golden colour. Not much banana, but a hoppy finish. A bit bready and malty. Sour and citric. Nice for an Erdinger.

Sweet lightly wheat aroma with a bit of metal. Clear yellow with a head. Flavour was slightly sweet with hints of citrus, banana, malt, wheat and hallertau. Fair whack of carbonation and a bit thin in the mouthfeel. Overall good for a hot day but I prefer the hefe.
Yellow with a big rocky head. Unclean banana aroma with some sugary and metallic notes. Not much flavour or body, just a fizzy and sweet flavour of old and/or brown bananas. No finish.

This was a disappointing beer from Erdinger as it lacks flavor in my opinion. It poured a huge rocky, frothy white head with a carbonated  and clear body with a yellow-gold hue. The nose consisted of malt, banana and clove. The flavor was sweet with a smooth and thin mouthfeel.

The aroma consists of some vanilla and some lemon zestiness.  As for the flavour, it is oddly watery and characterless for an Erdinger.  It is smooth but it also has a soda water mouthfeel.  As this is clear it could be targetted at fans of poor quality lager.
Flat and pale wheat beer with a sweet aroma.  The flavour is basically sweet.  Overall an average wheat beer, a bit disappointing.
UPDATED: AUG 23, 2003 gold yellow. white head. low aroma. one dimesional. fast finish. alcohol pokes in a bit

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2008 My god is this rated too low. I guess krystal weiss is too much like light beer for some but for me is superb. It is low cal rich in flavor, complex sweetness and chewy mouthfeel. What more could anyone want from this? Let others choke on bitter aftertaste this is great.
Yellow color with a white fluffy head. A sweet beer. Some yeast in the taste, and i think there is also a touch of banana flavour. A refreshing summer beer that comes with no aftertaste.

Big head and golden colour look gorgeous in my new Duvel glass.  In a thinner glass the colour is closer to straw.  Light wheat aroma.  If tap water tasted like this I'd be in heaven, but as a beer it is too light in flavour and finish.  Taste borders on sweet.  Stick to the Erdinger Hefewizen and Dunkel, even after mowing the lawn in the hot sun.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2005 Bottle. Foamy white head resting on top of lightly hazed gold. Nose is light banana, grass, hints of straw, wheat, and light yeast. Taste is similar but leans toward a European lager, oddly enough. Wheat, light fruit, straw, and some yasty notes. A bit disappointing. I rather enjoy their Hefeweizen, but this is a bit on the weak side. Body is medium with lots of bubbly carbonation. Finish is yeasty and wheaty with lighter fruit notes and some grass. Decent but poor compared to thier wheat and dunkel.
Clear golden body with big off-white head.  Aroma is lemony, some pear and a bit of banana.  Taste is mildly sweet wheat and apple, with some tartness.  Aftertaste is banana.  Watery palate.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2016 Rerate from tap. Very light fruity, subtly hoppy aroma. Golden, a bit fizzy, medium light mouthfeel. Fairly light flavor, does not offend. Old Rating:Still yeasty aroma, togethor with a lemony nose.
Deep golden, light fluffy head.
Quite malty and full which goes well with the banana and vanilla tastenotes.
Most interresting kristallweizen so far.
From the largest German wheat brewery. The wheat was almost invisible. It had clear straw color, small thin head and was very refreshing.

Has a clear yellow color with a lot of carbonation and a slight alcohol smell.  Taste is light wheat/fruity and finishes very fizzy.  Overall I did not like this too much as it did not have much flavor and was too fizzy.
Not a big champagne beer fan, and this is what this beer is.  Really bubbly, fizz in your mouth.  I would rather drink the weisse beer anyday.
Bottled. Golden coloured and clean. Fruity and sweet. Fizzy with some vanilla and a mellow body.

Clear, yellow/golden. Nice frothy head and sticky lace. Nose of subtle wheat, light banana sweetness and subtle pear maybe. Medium bodied, effervecent, semi-sweet with nice wheat character and decent ending bitterness but not a whole lot going on.
Typical golden color, with a big fluffy head. Has a well balanced taste, with a nice crisp finish. Has a medium to thin body, a definate summer beer.
Straw colow with a typical white fluffy head.  Clean wheat malt aroma and not much more.  flavors more typical of a light imported lager.
Disapointing weissbeer. No fruit, nothing special. Why make a weissbeer clear???

the dull thing about filtered wheatbeer is the impression it leaves... None maybe some citrus, the great thing about it is the dry crispy taste that makes u unthirsty after a long day in the skiingslope
This beer had huge crown, clear light amber look. Crisp simple taste, lack of any special characteristics. It was not very distinctive beer.
Filtered weizen beer, cristal clear as they say. I like the unfiltered ones better

Rough. Carbonated. Like mineral-water. Perhaps the German Budweiser? 
This thin brew is held together by excessive bubbles... Maybe a nice apertif, 
before serving Walmart chips and dip. Erdinger Premium is better while costing 
the same. Typical orange, yellow lagerish color. If you want a beer with dinner, 
but want it to hide behind the food, this would be the beer to choose. I dislike 
any fizzy-bite in the palate. Biggest beer-letdown Ive ever brought upon myself.
A very tasty and thirstquenching beer, fresh taste. Erdinger is the one that got me into drinking wheatbeers.
A good German White beer.
Great summer beer from Erdinger - but their Hefe has a little more of everything!

strong carbonation creates a large head with good size bubbles, the around is syrupy sweet. collor is clear golden with constant rising of bubbles. the taste  reasonable, but is finished with a strong metalic taste.
Somewhat less interesting than the dunkel Hefeweizen.
Big foamy head. Bubblegum aroma, taste is also very sweet with a little malt. Quite thick, lacks most wheat advantages. Is a beer for people who dont like bitter beers though.

The best thing about the beer is its appearance a clear golden color and a good head. But almost doent have any aroma. And the taste is only slightly of hob bitterness and wheat - but mostly a very tame flavor impression.
Probably the 2nd best beer in Germany! Nothing need be said except that is is delicious, smooth, & a favorite for anytime!
Real nice head and lacing. A decent aroma, but not quite the same as other german wheats.  Golden color. This is a drinkable wheat, but nothing special.
Very, very refreshing. Fantastic golden colour. Very smooth taste. This belongs to the more easy beers of Erdinger.
Nice, crisp golden brew, has a hint of Hefe-Weizen, but more refined. Keeps a great head, as well as lacing.

Pours a nice clear gold, the head is large, long lsting and white, lots of lace to coat the glass. Nose is malt, clean and crisp, a tat note of citrus. Sweet at the start, the top is light, the finish still has a lot of sweetness, somewhat dry, lightly acidic, little hop presence, but all in all a drinkable beer, pretty middle of the road. Ranks #847 on my master beer list.

Clear, refreshing appearance, but not much nose. Vanilla and nutty flavors that are very well blended. Overall a nice quality beer. Erdinger doesnt go out on limb with there beers, but they turn out some very nice stuff (see my ratings for Erdinger Weissbier und Dunkelweiss).
Quite a pleasant, drinkable wheaty brew.  The kristalls never taste as good as the hefes, I think.  Big head on this one (check out the photo for an image of it!).  Enjoyable.
Insane head...after I poured there was an inch of liquid and the rest was head to the tim of the glass.  fruity nose....smooth taste...not very wheaty, more fruity, pears.  Nice finish.
Ridiculous head!!  Effervescent smell, fruity notes.  I definitely get the sparkling part but not much wheatiness to speak of.  Slightly hoppy, pretty unremarkable.
This was my first ever German wheat! And I fell in love with the style at first sip. I later found out that there are much better examples of the style, but theres nothing like your first love!
This beer lacked distinctness and was quite bland. It had simple flavoursand a crisp clean finish.

RE-rate: just how i remembered it. Original rating- i just dont get this beer (and perhaps the style), why would you filter the yeast (and hence the flavour) out of a fairly decent weissbier, ends up tasting like a lager, like Hahn or Crown or something.
Like a bready Pils; a slight aroma of grain. Not awful, but not life-changing.

Head is initially huge, frothy, white, fully lasting. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly yeasty (dough), moderately malty (light bread). Flavor is lightly sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Little aromatic resemblance to a weiss, and not much flavor.

Well, it looks like a lager (except the longer-lasting frothy head), smells something like a lager (muted fruit tones, but generally bitter aroma) and doesnt have the yeast. So, what to make of this beast? Well, for me it was fine, but Im sure weiss bier drinkers will claim sacrilege--the weiss has been surgically removed! The fruit taste  is there, but you have to work to savor it. But I still like it, and it tastes good. Not a memorable beer (I liked the Erdinger hefe-weizen better) but I wouldnt refuse it or knock it too much either.

Easily the best light weiss Ive ever had.  Tall styrofoam head. Good palate and malty aroma, and Id have been hard-pressed to know that this wasnt barleybeer.  Slightly fruity. No wheatstink at all.
A very good tastin white beer. But the dunkeles and hefe-weizen versions are even better

Ok so I like light-tasting beer.  This one starts with a nice clean aroma out of the bottle, clean middle and finish.  Nothing extraordinary about the taste, but that is exactly what I like about it.  Its like the best parts of my favorite lagers (not wheats) with absolutely no bitterness or sour taste.  Makes me wish it was summer already.
duffs right, more like a lager than a wheat beer. totally unboisterous
Where is the taste? A little bit sweetness, a little bit hop. But nothing really there.
Are we sure this is a weissbier? Golden color with a big, frothy, white head. Slightly sharp and bitter. Not a bad beer, but not a good weiss.
Would make a great lager, but a wheat beer?  Smells like a weak hefeweissen, with a touch of apple-banana in the nose.  Yeast flavor with some apple dryness, otherwise quite bland and boring.
Not as nice as other Kristalklars but a fine beer.
